name: Garden studio apt
description:
Light and roomy, opening onto garden, this apartment is private, quiet and secure. There is a queen bed in the spacious combined bedroom/ sitting room that opens onto a private garden patio. In addition, enjoy your own bookshelf-lined den that includes a couch, TV, dining area, and electric fireplace. The apartment includes a kitchen/laundry room and bathroom. Close to downtown and to bike and walking trails. Special pricing available for monthly or longer stays.

The space
Only an hour's drive from the Pacific coast, the Cascade mountains, or Portland's many food, brew, literary, hip culture attractions, Salem is easy to get around with plenty of historic buildings, parks and gardens, brewpubs and wineries. From the house you can walk or bike to all many services or stretch out and cross the river to downtown on the beautiful pedestrian bridge.
The downstairs suite of about 900 sq ft or +/- 100 sq m includes a large, dividable bedroom space with queen bed
neighborhood_overview: There are 2 good-sized parks nearby, hilly neighborhoods and the many services within a mile or so, including a popular brewpub/distinctive Mexican eatery.  After your arrival here, it is not necessary to drive everywhere to enjoy this simple family neighborhood, and the greenness of the area.  Extended bike/walking paths lead across the river and south through green areas, with extended distance for a peaceful outdoors workout.
host_about:
An avid traveler and lover of the outdoors, I taught adult literacy and English to non-native speakers.   I enjoy winter skiing,  summer hiking , road trips or river trips, music, reading and favorite small children.  History, gardening, poetry and literature, food, agriculture are some of my interests.  Turkey, Greece, Ukraine, Mexico, Switzerland and France are places I've settled in for several weeks at a time.  In fact, staying in one place while exploring all around suits me better than continuous travel, and that's the experience I'd like to enable as a host.  Salem itself has much to offer besides options for scenic day trips: to the Pacific, to wineries of all sorts, cities north and south (Portland and Eugene), the Columbia Gorge and Mt Hood, waterfalls and forests, art galleries and museums.
One of my strengths is connecting folks with resources and opportunities.  At work, that's been my focus in helping newcomers with cultural adjustment.  Helping guests get the most from their time here appeals to me.  I also value independence and privacy, so knowing what guests prefer can make a good stay for us both.

name: Southtown Cottage
description:
Cute fully furnished house! Fresh bright paint, large open kitchen, and fenced yard. HVAC unit gives great cooling in the summer and heating in the winter! Garage conversion for partial bonus room. Second bed is a pull-out couch in living room.

House is located on a secluded looped street, 7 minutes from hospital and 5 minutes from downtown Salem. The home is surrounded by a big yard on all sides. Indoor washer and dryer included in unit, off street parking available. Thanks! sean

name: Chauffeurs Room @ the Villa
description:
NEWLY RENOVATED! Our home is in the quaint historic Fairmount Hills Neighborhood. This loft is great for business travelers, couples, and solo adventurers. We are close to Downtown, Bush Park, Salem Hospital, Willamette University, and Convention Center. We are also a great home base for exploring wineries and other communities. Our neighborhood is a safe place to walk and explore and our property has security cameras to enhance your safety.

The space
The studio is a quiet, private retreat above the garage, with all the necessities for a comfortable stay. The kitchen is equipped with fridge, microwave, hotplate, toaster and electric kettle.

We will get you started with homemade granola and sometimes a baked treat. Complimentary tea and coffee are provided along with a long list of restaurant recommendations.

The queen size, pillow top mattress is made up with luxury linens.

Guests are welcome to use the back patio and feel f
neighborhood_overview: Safe, quiet community, historic neighborhood. The studio is a few blocks from the Salem Art Fair, a short walk to eateries, museums, library, parks, Salem Hospital, Willamette University and the Capitol. This is wine country and we will be happy to share our favorites for you to visit.
host_about: We are an active couple that loves our home, neighborhood and surrounding area. We love the solitude of hiking and the warmth of an evening surrounded by family and friends.

name: Single room in Comfort Home
description:
Comfort Home was initially established for traveling medical professionals for Salem Health where I am the Clinical Excellence Coordinator. I provide discounts to RNs and other disciplines. I also rent to diverse guests and have enjoyed learning from everyone I've met. This home is perfect for sharing as I live in one section, the rooms are on the opposite side and our common space is perfect for everyone. I look forward to interacting should you be interested in making a request.

The space
Two rental rooms share a very large full bathroom with both tub and shower. One room has a private half bathroom. Guests share the grand room with living, dining and kitchen surrounding a three-sided gas fireplace. Guest can use home gym, backyard with hot tub and barbecue. The kitchen is designed for cooking and will share small amounts of condiments, spices and other items used for cooking. My space is on opposite side of house, upstairs and private.

Sel
neighborhood_overview:
Well established high end neighborhood with very friendly neighbors. Located on a cul-de-sac with adequate parking and little traffic so it is very quiet. Feels like a mountain resort due to the large and dense oak and pine trees. Back yard opens into quiet and beautiful neighborhood park.

10 minutes from I-5
Sunnyslope Shopping Center is a short walk from my home and has a wonderful grocery store (Roth's), U.S. Bank, restaurants, frozen yogurt shop, hair and nail salon, and more. Also within walking distance is a Walgreens, post office, gift shop and bakery. 4 miles from downtown Salem. Blocks from gas station.
host_about: I have lived in this home 21 years and have truly made it comfortable to both me and my guests.  The house is perfectly designed to accommodate guests as we built the 2-story extension that I live in upstairs which provides privacy for both myself and my guests.  My guests and I commonly share the downstairs which includes the kitchen, dining and living room, gym and back yard where there is a hot tub.

name: Charming 1925 Craftsman centrally located!
description:
The State Capitol, Salem's favorite breakfast spot (Word of Mouth), Willamette University, Salem Hospital and downtown are all close by! The inside of this nearly one hundred year old Craftsman house has a comfortable charm with a mix of old and new style. Three bedrooms, dining/family room, sunporch full of books and plants, huge backyard for pets, fire pit and pool. We request $10 extra per night per dog (max $50 and no other animals) for cleaning purposes. City of Salem license: #22-101136-LI

The space
This is a 1925 Craftsman home that has stood the test of time. Settled in an older part of Salem, the house has a charm and comfort for most to enjoy. The house sits on a double lot, leaving lots of room to play and enjoy the outside on nice days. We have a front sunporch and a patio outside with a firepit (and PLENTY of wood!). Our 32'x16' swimming pool will be up in summer months with good weather conditions. If you would like to see specifics on two of the be
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighbors and our neighborhood. Tree-lined streets, sidewalks, and quiet. We love how central it is to most things in Salem. And we love how central Salem is to most things in western Oregon. The neighborhood and Salem is overall very safe but cars have had things disappear when people forget to lock!
host_about:
I co-host with my husband Arnaud. I'll be the communicator online, he takes care of the rest (cleaning, problem solving). 

We enjoy traveling to different countries, mostly to know the people who live there. It just so happened that Christy traveled to Europe in 2015 and met Arnaud in Belgium. 

We have been renting our house to commuters and friends for over 10 years (even before Airbnb) so we are very used to shared spaces/renting private rooms. When we travel (as we like to a lot), we rent out the entire house. Music and learning and relationships are other passions in life. 

In 2019, we launched a GPS-enabled Oregon audio tours business  called Together Anywhere. Let us know if you want to know more!

name: Spacious Suite w/ Private Sauna and AC in City
description:
Beautiful, large 770 sq. ft. private Suite, with own key entry. Sparkling clean, upscale comfortable, you'll feel pampered right away.

Bedroom with en-suite and private sauna, full size living room, kitchenette. Clutter-free space with garden patio and BBQ. Convenient West Salem location, very close to downtown and Willamette U., Salem Hospital, wineries, shops and parks.

Fully licensed and compliant with City of Salem codes.

The space
An actual guest review: "Fantastic place to stay. Beautiful part of Salem and the house was nicer than advertised. You can't go wrong."

We welcome friendly guests of all races and ethnicities from all over the world.

Enjoy privacy in a beautiful and comfortable space with large master bedroom, private large living room including big screen TV and "kitchenette," which includes a microwave, mini-fridge, Keurig coffee machine and bar sink (there is no stove.) There is also a new Infra
neighborhood_overview: Explore wineries, waterfalls and the spectacular Oregon coast from your lovely and quiet West Salem location.  The Suite is within walking distance of shops and restaurants.  Only 2 miles to Capitol, Willamette University and downtown area.  Lots of trees and parks in neighborhood.  Beautiful hiking opportunities abound including "Silver Falls" which boasts 10 glorious waterfalls and miles of hiking trails.  Willamette Valley wineries including "Wine Spectator" top 100 picks will delight you.  Dozens of fabulous wineries in Salem and even more a short drive away.  The beach is only 45 minutes away.  One hour from Portland and airport.
host_about:
We love the Pacific Northwest!  Beautiful trees, parks, wineries and cultural activities abound.  Our new retreat/apartment will amaze you.  It's 770 sq ft. of gorgeous, quiet space and is an incredible value.  House hunting?  Visiting faculty?  This is the perfect home for you.

We are former long-term residents of Santa Cruz, California and never thought we could love anyplace as much--but we found out we love Salem and the Pacific Northwest even more!  We are voracious readers, faith and family are very important to us and we love to cook, entertain and visit wineries.  

We have a very large house because we have 5 grown children who we hope will visit--but our kids have very busy lives all over the country--In the meantime, we'd love to share our home with you.

name: Stylish Private Urban Guest House
description:
Enjoy our private, clean, comfortable, renovated guest house close to downtown Salem. We are on the city bicycle route in a vintage, tree-lined neighborhood close to amenities. We offer a relaxing outdoor space and fully fenced yard.

The space
The guest house is renovated with reclaimed wood used throughout. The bed is a QUEEN with a PURPLE brand mattress and quality linens. There is a small kitchenette with a sink, mini-fridge and microwave. We encourage guests to visit the local eateries and not to "cook" in the space. However, you can heat leftovers or items in the microwave. We do not provide pots, pans and cooking items for this reason. There is air conditioning (and heat, of course), and an additional heater in the bathroom. We provide HIGH SPEED Wifi. The SmartTV has guest Netflix. There is an outdoor space for lounging when the weather is nice and a portico entry if it is raining, so you can remove wet gear. The yard is fully fenced and secure if you brin
neighborhood_overview: We are on the city bicycle route in a historic, tree-lined neighborhood. Walk to the Salem Farmer’s Market, Broadway Coffee House, McMenamins Boon's Treasury, and more. We are also a mile from downtown and a short drive to Willamette University.
host_about: Robert and I are avid campers and enjoy living in the Pacific Northwest. Although we love to travel, it is hard to leave the area as there are so many beautiful places to enjoy. We have a grown son and are dog lovers, love coffee, books, and always a great conversation around a camp fire. I am also a Realtor in Salem, so if you have any questions or needs, just let me know how I can help!

name: Spacious home near downtown Salem
description:
This charming 1927 home has been completely remodeled. The Willamette
River runs behind the homes across the street and the centrally located house is a one mile walk or bus ride to downtown.

The space
This is an upstairs apartment in a lovely older home that has been completely remodeled. It is
surrounded by big leaf maple trees and the Willamette River runs behind the
houses across the street. There is a bedroom with a queen sized bed and a
couch that folds out to a queen sized bed in the living room It is an upstairs apartment and the shower is in the clawfoot bathtub so it is not suitable for guests with mobility issues. The outside front entrance is shared but there is a locked door to the apartment at the top of the stairs.

Guest access
To those who have stayed here before, the airbnb is now upstairs. I will be living downstairs You have access to the entire second floor. You have a private locked entrance
neighborhood_overview:
The proximity to the river is a great part of this neighborhood as are the large trees. Riverfront park and the carousal and West Salem Park are about a one mile walk from the house as is downtown Salem. The Broadway
district with an Independent theatre, coffee shops, restaurants and a wine
bar is a little less than a mile away. There is a rail line about 4 blocks from the house. Although it is not a main line, trains do pass through about twice a night and blow their whistle. Earplugs are provided.
host_about:
I am a retired psychotherapist.  It has been a labor of love to restore this lovely old house.  I love the outdoors and often hike, camp or kayak. I also enjoy meeting new people.  
Traveling is my passion and I have visited many countries and have enjoyed my stays in air b and b's.  Volunteerism is another passion and I hope to volunteer in Central America soon. There is some awesome energy in this house and I believe that more people will bring more good energy.

description:
Beautiful private room in quite neighborhood, furnished with comfortable large queen size bed, large desk w/ lamp, private fridge and your own Iron/board for your daily life. The bed has an additional pull-out twin mattress to accommodate the extra person if needed.

The house is very quite and has a peaceful environment. Down stairs is the common area kitchen, laundry & a great lounge area. Feel free to use them all, kitchen to cook your favorite meal and laundry for your clothing

The space
Beautiful room in a quiet neighborhood furnished with Queen bed large desk, Iron/board night stand w. light. The Bed has an additional pull-out twin size mattress to accommodate an extra person, please note that if you’re needing the additional mattress to be set up, you MUST request that ahead of time . Enjoy this quiet and peaceful environment. The living, dining and laundry room is all included for your use. There's a desk in this room, and a small fridge. Th
neighborhood_overview: It's a wonderful and quiet neighborhood with beautiful trees that cover the streets. Given that the house is over 100 years old and has been fully remodeled/restored, it truly is a gem!
host_about: I am in my early 30's came from a great Biblical missionary family, I enjoy beautiful  Oregon outdoors and different cultural foods. Currently my family and I live and work in Portland.  I have a great house in Salem that we decided to rent out for long and short term via Airbnb i am gone a lot and most of the time i am not in Salem but at my house in Portland . All 5 bedrooms are furnished with welcoming environment for your enjoyable stay.

name: Home away from home
description:
Right in the beautiful heart of Salem, Close to downtown.
Quiet neighborhood on a .
Full kitchen available if needed for occasional use.
Room includes a full size bed, 40" TV, microwave, small fridge, utensils, dishes, full length mirror, iron, Keurig coffee bar, walk in closet, work space and a lounge chair.

The space
My home is neat and tidy. I love cute things but not clutter. I hear people say it's a very relaxing comfortable place.

Guest access
You can feel comfortable knowing the hall bathroom is mainly for my Airbnb guests with only occasional family & friends that might visit on the weekend. Washer & dryer are easily located in the hallway close to your room. Kitchen if you need on occasion is available. Back patio for relaxing is lovely, help yourself.

Other things to note
I have easy street parking right out front house on low traffic cul-de-sac. Outside sensor lights for safety. Door access

description:
Experience a beautiful peaceful room in Salem's quite historic neighborhood. Room is furnished with Queen size bed, over-sized large desk. Great for business and long stay guests. Closet is equipped with Iron & ironing board extra towels and hangers for your convenience. The room also has an additional full pull-out mattress to accommodate up to 2 additional guest. name: Private Suite 5 mins to Downtown /60 mins to Coast
description:
Welcome to your Home away from Home!
We surrounded by gardens, fields of flowers, vineyards and green pastures. The city is perfectly located an hour from the ocean and an hour from the Cascade Mountains.

Our place is close to family-friendly activities and restaurants and dining. You’ll love my place because of the outdoors space and the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and families (with kids). It is located in a safe and quiet neighborhood.

The space
The bedroom is located in the basement with a fully furnished living room and have its own full bathroom. Guest/s will have the entire basement to themselves.

In the living room, a huge sectional couch that converts into a queen size bed for extra sleeping space. A 65" TV with a DirectTV access and High speed internet. Washer and dryer is also available for long term guests.

Guest access
There is beverage and snack
neighborhood_overview: Our home is located on a quiet cul-de-sac and very safe neighborhood.
host_about:
Along with my husband Bob, we started our Airbnb back in 2016. Bob was originally from Southern California. I was born and raised in the Philippines and moved to United States in 2007. We started dating in 2011 and finally tie the knot in 2017.  

We are both working for the State of Oregon, I am an Accountant and my husband, Bob is a Regulatory Manager. 

We love to travel and meet new people - explore new countries learn their culture! We also both enjoy being in the water - snorkeling and scuba diving. Our favorite destinations are the Philippines, Hawaii and Mexico. During our free time, we try new local restaurants and breweries, hike and camp around the Oregon Coast. We love connecting with new people and sharing stories.

We're sincerely happy to host you. Our goal is to give the best and most relaxing stay and memorable experience during your stay.

name: 2 Bedrooms/Private Entry/Private Bath, S Salem
description:
Our place is a 4-bedroom, 3-bath ranch house in South Salem. We live in the house. Airbnb space is partitioned from the main house affording you privacy. Self check-in thru garage via a keyless pad. High speed internet. A/C/Heating.
Basic accommodations. It is clean, quiet, and safe. No Cleaning fee. No TV.

We are a family of three plus a friendly dog (Ellie) and a cat named, Gus. Our pets are off limits in the Airbnb space.

No smoking. No pets.

Oregon License #: 18-124455-LI

The space
Rigorous and intensive sanitizing and disinfecting of all areas in the Airbnb area. Bedrooms are well ventilated and has lots of natural light.
Towels, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash are provided. Bathroom has lots of hot water.

Coffee pods and tea bags complimentary.

Guests are welcome to use the sunroom. Access is through the door to our living room. Sunroom is chilly in the winter time.

Quick and easy access to downtown Salem, I-5, Costco, the beautiful Oregon coast, Silver Falls State Park, Riverfront Park, Minto Brown and Bush Parks. There is a community park two houses down from our house. Walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops, pubs, and grocery stores.
host_about: I am pretty easygoing, warm, and enjoy company. I love hiking,  gardening, yoga, and exploring places far and near.

One bedroom with queen bed and a separate living room in our finished basement. Perfect for one or two people traveling for work / school at the nearby hospitals, the Capitol, or Willamette University.

Close to major institutions for the commuter, student, or visiting family. Willamette University, the Capitol, and Salem Hospital are about 1 mile away and are walkable through Bush Park. Oregon State Hospital is only 3 miles away on surface streets.

The space
Our newly painted, floored, carpeted, and furnished spare basement bed and living rooms are private and spacious. Your space is separated by a door, and includes a separate bedroom, living room, and dinette.

The guest rooms are accessed through the front door in the main level of our home and down the stairs to the basement.

The rooms stay consistently cool throughout the day at about 65 degrees. We have central heating, but there are two radiant heaters installed in the bo
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood is old and beautiful! Quiet, friendly, and safe. I love to walk the tree shaded streets among the historic homes.

There are two mini markets and a donut shop in 5 minutes walking distance. A Chinese and Mexican restaurant about the same, and two grocery stores 10 minutes walking.

By car, there is about everything you need in just a few minutes.

Downtown Salem is only about one and a half miles away where there is shopping and a variety of restaurants. From downtown, the Willamette River, River Front Park, and Gerry Frank Amphitheater are extremely close.

Bush Park is a peaceful 5 minute walk away. There are public access tennis courts, a running trail around the park, soccer and baseball fields, tree groves, and Pringle Creek runs through. You can spend hours exploring the grounds which are across the street from Willamette University and the state Capitol.

description:
The Art Loft is located in the cozy historic Fairmount Hill neighborhood. We are close to City Center, Bush Park, Willamette University, and the Convention Center.
The loft is great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers by offering a private entrance with treetop views. Enjoy a nice secluded stay adventure.

The space
Our light-filled North-facing studio with large windows is a modern detached space that includes a comfy queen bed, wood stripped ceilings, hardwood floors, air conditioning, full bathroom, kitchenette, small sitting area and french doors that lead to the outdoor sitting area in our private backyard.

It’s a perfect studio size space that is well utilized. The kitchenette includes a small fridge, stone counters, stainless sink, toaster, coffee maker, coffee press, electric tea kettle and microwave. We will get you started with creamer, almond milk, yogurt and granola. Complementary tea and coffee are provided alo
neighborhood_overview: One of the best neighborhoods in Salem-- just a quick distance from all you could possibly want for shops, restaurants, bars, music venues, parks, playgrounds, many within walking distance.  Our neighborhood is a great place to take a walk to see beautiful homes with diverse architecture.
host_about:
I am a gallery owner in Oregon and love seeing art from all over the world.  My hope is to visit the many airbnb's that are owned by those that appreciate the arts.  
My husband and I are easy going and love to explore the places we visit.  We like to check out the architecture, the arts and unique shopping (we aren't interested in shopping malls).  We love renting bikes and exploring.  
My website is (Website hidden by Airbnb)  You can get a good idea of who I am by visiting my blog that is on the website.  Thank you again for considering us.
Mary Lou

name: Ben Lomond House
description:
Welcome to Ben Lomond House! Guest reviews confirm that this home is an ideal gathering spot as well as a quiet space for family, relaxation or work. The well appointed kitchen, comfortable beds in large bedrooms, wood burning fireplace, grand piano, and numerous spaces for relaxation make this home very desirable. Past guests include multi-generational families, attorneys, professionals attending conferences, and recording artists. It is my hope that you will feel completely at home.

The space
Ben Lomond House sits on a quiet, secluded street in central South Salem that is a mix of historic homes including the Governor's Mansion (1/2 mile) as well as other nice homes built during the last century. Adults tend to comment on the master suite with view of the gardens through the bay window, numerous dining spots, beds and linens, and genuine works of art adorning the walls. Kids are drawn to the lofts in upstairs bedrooms, the tower room, balcony, and toys and game
neighborhood_overview: The home is very centrally located in the heart of the city. It is on a quiet, secluded street in a neighborhood that is a mix of historic homes including the Governor's Mansion as well as other nice homes built during this century. One block away is a nice park adjoining a turn of the century school with playground; four blocks away numerous dining options can be found, including the best coffee house/creperie and a restaurant with 20 beers on tap. Wine country starts just outside city limits and Portland and the Oregon Coast are a one hour drive away.

name: Central Salem - Bright Queen Room (+ desk)
description:
Your room: a quiet workspace with a desk in front of a large window looking out on the book-laden porch, a queen size bed with room darkening curtains. Your hosts: an early 40s couple (both vaxxed and boosted) with no kids and two awesome dogs. $5 extra for a couple (in booking charge). Please no check-ins past 10pm.

There is one other Airbnb room in the house with shared access to restroom. Bedroom door has lock and key for your security and valuables.

City of Salem license: #22-101136-LI

The space
This is a 1925 Craftsman home that has stood the test of time. Settled in an older part of Salem, the house has a charm and comfort for most to enjoy. The house sits on a double lot, leaving lots of room to play and enjoy the outside on nice days. We have a front sun porch, sitting space in the back yard and a secluded lounging area with fire pit (and plenty of wood).

Guest access
Your bedroom is in the front of the house
neighborhood_overview: We love our neighbors and our neighborhood. Tree-lined streets, sidewalks, and quiet. We love how central it is to most things in Salem. And we love how central Salem is to most things in western Oregon. The neighborhood and Salem is overall very safe but cars have had things disappear when people forget to lock!
host_about:
I co-host with my husband Arnaud. I'll be the communicator online, he takes care of the rest (cleaning, problem solving). 

We enjoy traveling to different countries, mostly to know the people who live there. It just so happened that Christy traveled to Europe in 2015 and met Arnaud in Belgium. 

We have been renting our house to commuters and friends for over 10 years (even before Airbnb) so we are very used to shared spaces/renting private rooms. When we travel (as we like to a lot), we rent out the entire house. Music and learning and relationships are other passions in life. 

In 2019, we launched a GPS-enabled Oregon audio tours business  called Together Anywhere. Let us know if you want to know more!

name: Century House Cedar Room with lots of space, light
description:
The "Cedar Room" is a large, bright room. Named for the 80-ft Cedar tree outside your window. Room includes a queen bed, dresser, lunch table and chairs, a small desk, and a loveseat. Shower, toilet, and sink ensuite. Across the hall is a sitting/reading/play/eating area, and a kitchenette with fridge, microwave, coffee/tea maker, rice cooker, crockpot, mini-skillet, dishes, utensils, induction cooktop/pans. Reservation includes a significant morning "snack" of fruit, pastry, protein, etc.

The space
Enjoy the ambiance of a turn-of-the-century home with top to bottom renovations and upgrades. Outside, enjoy the shade of a mini forest of conifers and maples, and a cozy campfire when the weather allows.
Within a one-mile walk you will find the Capitol, museums, the university, and historic downtown, and the beautiful Willamette River.

Guest access
Off-street gated parking.

Other things to note
Bike shop, tools
neighborhood_overview: Century House is walking distance to the State Capitol, Willamette University, Amtrak, and downtown. Enjoy gardens, historic homes, museums, restaurants, etc.
host_about:
Bicycling is my passion and my past-time, as well as my recipe for physical and emotional well-being.  Most recently, I have enjoyed “packing down” my bike with gear and heading down the road - for an overnight, or three, or three weeks.  This gives a whole new meaning to “bed and breakfast”.

When I’m not cycling, I’m usually busy cooking, cleaning, reading, sewing or watching the trees and flowers grow in my little forest; and, of course, accommodating the many fascinating guests who find their way to Century House from all corners of the globe.  My life is truly enriched by the diversity of perspectives and experiences that guests bring with them.

I confess, my favorite guests may be the children. With a full career of working in the field of early childhood, I never cease to be wowed by the uninhibited enthusiasm, curiosity, and resilience of the younger generation.  I am thrilled and dedicated to being a family-friendly business.

Another of my endeavors is the promotion/education of good nutrition.  I might be seen pedaling to a local farm to fill my packs with broccoli for the local food bank  - or, with fresh kale for a morning smoothie :-).  Don’t worry, there is still room for a brownie or an oatmeal cookie on the dessert tray.  After all, we need our dark chocolate, and our oatmeal, right?

name: Country Garden Retreat
description:
This spacious retreat offers everything you need to relax and enjoy your stay in a country garden setting within easy walking distance of Corban University. Stargazers and eclipse-watchers will appreciate the open sky views.

The space
Our South Salem home is situated just outside the Salem city limits. The ground floor of this large house is all yours with over 1200 square feet of interior space. Come and go as you please through a separate private entrance.

For extra safety, we've added a professional grade Air Doctor clean air purifier to our space.

There's lots of room to kick back and relax.

Guest access
Sleep tight in a quiet and cool bedroom with an extremely comfortable queen bed and luxury linens. A very comfortable twin air bed with a twin bed mattress topper is also available on request. Enjoy a private bathroom and shower, wifi access, extra-large living room with flat-screen satellite TV, dining table an
neighborhood_overview:
We're in the country just enough to feel quiet and spacious, yet still conveniently located for easy freeway access and multiple shopping and dining options.

- walk to Corban University
- Willamette University is 5.7 miles away
- downtown Salem is 7 miles away
- hiking and biking opportunities abound in easy driving distance, including the Riverfront City Park, Silver Falls State Park and the Oregon Garden.
- an hour's drive from Portland
- 65 miles to the Oregon Coast (Lincoln City is the nearest beach)
- Portland International Airport (PDX) 63.5 miles away
- Eugene Airport is 68 miles away
host_about:
Tom and I are originally from the Portland area and have lived in Salem for over 40 years. We raised our three sons here and now enjoy the quiet, natural setting full of hummingbirds, woodpeckers and deer. This place is like our own private park. 

We've got loads of flowers here. Over the years, Tom has planted apple and cherry trees, a plum tree, a fig tree, rhubarb, herbs and tomatoes, and a big berry patch full of blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, strawberries and currants. We like to call it "Tom's Berry Farm" but it isn't really a farm - though we sometimes joke that we could probably open up a roadside stand with all the produce.

Family is the most important thing to us and we enjoy spending time with our kids and grand kids. Other interests include cooking, reading, salmon fishing and volunteering for local charities like the Marion County Food Bank and Assistance League.

Our youngest son introduced us to Airbnb and we're excited for the opportunity to meet new people and share our peaceful home.

name: Sunnyslope Retreat - Private Entry, Fireplace & AC
description:
Enjoy beautiful Willamette Valley Wine Country in this one-bedroom, garden level apartment in a quiet South Salem neighborhood. Featuring a private entrance, fireplace, Sleep Number bed & air conditioning. Business ready, and close to Willamette, Corban and Western Oregon Universities, with shopping and restaurants nearby. Enjoy historic downtown Salem (a 10-minute drive), wine tasting at local wineries, or write that next great novel while you sit by the fire. Sunnyslope Retreat awaits you!

The space
Sunnyslope Retreat is a private apartment on the garden level of our home in the quiet South Salem Sunnyslope neighborhood, and is perfect for 1 or 2 adults (no children please). The entrance is at the rear of the house, with access down the left-side driveway.

Newly renovated (summer 2017), the 685 sq. ft. apartment has a large living area with comfortable furniture, 42" flat screen TV, Streaming RokuTV (access Netflix, Hulu, HBO, etc.), ceiling fans
neighborhood_overview:
We are 10 minutes from I-5, off the Kuebler exit.
Close by, the Sunnyslope Shopping Center is a short walk from our home and has a wonderful grocery store (Roth's), U.S. Bank, laundromat, restaurants, frozen yogurt shop, hair and nail salon, and more. Also within walking distance is a Walgreens, post office, gift shop and bakery.

Downtown Salem is a 10-minute drive and has much to offer in the way of restaurants, coffee shops and shopping. Of special interest is Riverfront Park, whose two pedestrian bridges link it to West Salem and to Minto-Brown Island Park, which spreads out over 1,200 acres of lush, open and wooded areas. Willamette University is 4 miles away and just east of downtown. Corban University is 6 miles to the east.

Salem is located in the verdant Willamette Valley, famous for its wineries and farms. We are just over an hour from the coast and a couple hours from the mountains.
host_about:
Chuck and Lorie met in a traveling theater company and have logged a lot of miles in their careers. Chuck is retired from a career as an itinerant  professional actor and storyteller. Lorie works as a legal secretary at a law firm in Salem. Travel is a part of their DNA and they often stay at Airbnbs. 

They have 3 sons, one daugher in-law and 4 grandchildren. Family is a priority and their home is filled with rich memories of raising their family in Salem.

name: Immaculate and Quiet Home Centrally Located
description:
Beautiful open home with 3200 square feet of amazing space! This home has 5 bedrooms and 3 full bathrooms.

A family room, living room, gormet kitchen, 3 bedrooms (including a master suite) and two bathrooms are located on the top level.

On the lower level is a game room with a big screen TV (including game system), bunk bed room and 2nd master suite. The outside has one top level deck with seating area and one back patio with grill (Summer, Spring, Fall) and outside seating.

The space
Close to park and a few blocks from a large, open public-use field. The home is located in a very private culdesac and a short distance to restaurants, coffee, shopping and much more.

Guest access
The home includes a front top deck with seating and a back patio for barbeque and relaxation. The bonus room has a big screen TV. This room also has a ping pong table a sink area for enjoying snacks.

Other things to note
neighborhood_overview: This is an extremely quiet culdesac with only 5 homes located here. There is virtually no traffic so is extremely safe for children. There is an outside basketball hoop and space to ride bikes. We ask that guests limit traffic in and out and be settled in at an appropriate time of night. We ask this out of respect for our neighbors. We are also sticklers about the number of guests on the reservation matching the number of guests actually staying in the home. Thank you so much for respecting our home as we want to keep it beautiful for you.

name: Historic & Charming Salem Home w/Mill Creek Views!
description:
Experience the stunning scenery and rich history of the Willamette Valley with a trip to this updated 19th-century vacation rental. The historic home is located in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance to the State Capitol and downtown Salem. Enjoy the sounds of the serene Mill Creek rushing by while you wine, dine, and grill on the patio. Head into town to tour museums and parks, visit one of the area’s many wineries, or bring the kids to top attractions like the Enchanted Forest!

The space
1,600 Sq Ft | Creekside Location | Dog Friendly w/ Fee | Furnished Patio | Sports/Gear Storage

Originally constructed in 1898, the renovated 'Daniel S. Yoder House' is on the National Registry of Historic Homes and boasts a seamless fusion of old-world sophistication and modern elegance, equipped with every amenity you need to feel at home!

Bedroom 1: King Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Upstairs Den: Queen Futon | Downstairs Den: Queen Sleeper Sofa<
neighborhood_overview:
DOWNTOWN: Oregon State Capitol (1.2 miles), Bush’s Pasture Park (1.3 miles), Gilbert House Children’s Museum (1.7 miles), Riverfront City Park (1.9 miles)
ATTRACTIONS: Enchanted Forest (9.0 miles), The Oregon Garden (13.7 miles), Evergreen Aviation & Space Museum (24.5 miles)
OUTDOORS: Mill Creek (walking distance), Minto-Brown Island Park (4.1 miles), Croisan Creek Trail (5.7 miles), Walsh's Landing Trailhead (6.7 miles)
WINERIES: Honeywood Winery (1.2 miles), Redhawk Vineyard & Winery (5.8 miles), Eola Hills (9.0 miles), Ankeny Vineyard (10.9 miles)
AIRPORT: Portland International Airport (58.5 miles)

host_about:
I am a retired medical transcriptionist. I was the first server in our craft brewery back in 2012 and loved serving people. Previously, I have been a housekeeper for two 5-star hotels. A long time ago I was an art student in Brooklyn. We moved a lot when I was a child because my father was in the Navy during WW2.

Ian is from England. We met 30 years ago when he was working in a quaint hostel in Ashland; a place known for its Shakespeare festival. I was a guest. He lived under the stairs just like Harry Potter. He is the head brewer in the craft brewery we’re partners in.

name: Century House Maple Suite 18-102571 LI
description:
Two bedrooms, a large completely refurbished master bath, a well-furnished kitchenette, and two common areas for eating, playing, working, reading, etc. Large queen room with lots of light, table/chairs, rocker, desk, and its own heating/cooling; and quiet corner room with double bed, easy chair, desk. Outside are dozens of shady places to relax, even in the rain. Your reservation includes a significant morning "snack" of fruit, pastry, protein.

The space
Enjoy a large collection of handmade quilts, and a large collection of adventure stories related to bicycling and mountain climbing. Also, find numerous amenities for young children. Television is NOT one of them :-).
(PLEASE NOTE: The queen bedroom has AC; the double does not, but it is on the shady side of the house with new insulation, new windows, and a ceiling fan. The AC from the bigger room can be "shared" when the door is open.)

Guest access
Gated off-street parking. Wit
host_about:
Bicycling is my passion and my past-time, as well as my recipe for physical and emotional well-being.  Most recently, I have enjoyed “packing down” my bike with gear and heading down the road - for an overnight, or three, or three weeks.  This gives a whole new meaning to “bed and breakfast”.

When I’m not cycling, I’m usually busy cooking, cleaning, reading, sewing or watching the trees and flowers grow in my little forest; and, of course, accommodating the many fascinating guests who find their way to Century House from all corners of the globe.  My life is truly enriched by the diversity of perspectives and experiences that guests bring with them.

I confess, my favorite guests may be the children. With a full career of working in the field of early childhood, I never cease to be wowed by the uninhibited enthusiasm, curiosity, and resilience of the younger generation.  I am thrilled and dedicated to being a family-friendly business.

Another of my endeavors is the promotion/education of good nutrition.  I might be seen pedaling to a local farm to fill my packs with broccoli for the local food bank  - or, with fresh kale for a morning smoothie :-).  Don’t worry, there is still room for a brownie or an oatmeal cookie on the dessert tray.  After all, we need our dark chocolate, and our oatmeal, right?

name: Sasquatch’s Cozy Stay
description:
Subtle touches make this space special: sliding barn doors, open layout, radiant heat in the porcelain and bamboo floors, organic cotton towels, and organic percale sheets with both down and synthetic pillows. Enjoy the garden on sunny days and covered patio when it rains.

PLEASE NOTE: The layout, doors, and shared common space means less privacy. Great for crashing after a conference, not for honeymooners. Courteous single visitors, travel nurses, and road trippers preferred.

The space
Walking in the front door, you’ll find yourself in the largest room in the house, the living room. To the left, two open doorways lead to the kitchen, dining area, and bathroom. The main bedroom is immediately to the right when you walk into the living room, and guest room is past the couch, also to the right in the back/ north-most part of the house. Directly across the guest room on the other side of the living room is the laundry room which features a sliding patio d
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood (Grant) is cute and friendly, and the house is sandwiched by an elementary school and Boys and Girls Club. There’s also a church across the street that has band practice on Tuesday evenings- the music is wonderful! During the school year there is a drop off/ pick up rush twice a day but it only lasts about 15 minutes. Once in a while there is a Boys and Girls Club event that also spurs some extra traffic, but the sounds of children laughing always outweighs it. The house is within walking distance to Broadway Coffee, Barrel and Keg wine bar and tap house, Salem Cinema, Christo's Pizza, McMenamins' Brewery, Tony’s Tacos, among other local gems. Downtown proper is about a mile away and the capitol buildings and Saturday Market are a 15 minute walk. Please let me know if you need recommendations for food, beverages, or sight-seeing.
host_about: I moved to Salem in September 2016 for a promotion as a soil scientist. I love that I get to be outside and examine nature for work. For fun I practice yoga, taste and brew beer, hike, x-country ski, snowshoe, see live music, garden, and read. I'm always looking for new ways to grow and explore!

name: Guest Cottage at Vista Manor
description:
Guest cottage located in South Salem on a large wooded lot. Close to restaurants, grocery stores, Banks, Parks, Willamette University and Salem Hospital. The bedroom is upstairs king with a king size bed. The sofa bed that is a double, is on the first floor. When we enter into spring ants are out. If food is left out on counters and tables it will attract ants. I ask guests not to leave food out. Guests who have been conscientious have not had an issue.

The space
The guest Cottage is a separate unit attached to the main home but has a private entrance.My home was built in the 1920s. It is on a acre wooded lot. We have chickens, ducks, 3 cats and a dog. The animals are in a back area of the property. Only the doggie comes out to visit our guests. Our guest of course are welcome to visit all the animals.

Guest access
The guest cottage is located on a large lot with lots of trees. Guests are welcome to enjoy the patios and yard.

<

name: Ground floor guest suite: city, woods, wineries
description:
No cleaning fees or chores. Pets stay free.

A beautifully unique cedar craft home on small acreage on the edge of town, this ground floor guest suite has all the amenities of my favorite hotels, like Hyatt, Westin and Marriott. This rustic-modern space has a kitchenette, fridge, freezer, filtered water, microwave, hot plate, toaster and several coffee makers.

Deer are daily visitors, along with a variety of wild birds and many other friendly critters.

The space
Over 900 square feet of relaxed, peaceful living in this Retreat at AntlerWood Hollow. How are we in the middle of the woods, yet only 4 minutes from the heart of Oregon's capital city?

Remodeled in late 2017, much thought has been put into this ground floor escape. Friends and guests describe this home as "the most Oregon home" they have ever seen. I agree.

I love Oregon and this property has the best of Oregon. The space has a world travelers' theme with li
neighborhood_overview: This home is about a half-mile from a neighborhood park, and just one more mile to the largest connected park system in the country! The property is on a country road and so you won't run into neighbors.
host_about:
I'm clean, quiet, organized and polite. I take pride in cleaning up after myself and leaving the smallest imprint possible. 

I travel for work and occasionally to explore. I'm a marketing consultant and work with community organizations.

name: Beautiful 1940s Fairmount Hills Bungalow in Salem
description:
Beautifully Remodeled 1940s Bungalow in Salem, OR close to Downtown, Bush Park, Willamette University, the Oregon State Capitol, Riverfront Park and so much more! Read more details about the luxurious space below and don't hesitate to book now!

The space
Fully furnished, luxurious bungalow in the upscale Fairmount Hills neighborhood of Salem, Oregon. The bungalow features the charm and character of the 1940s architecture with original hardwood floors, a cozy fireplace, arched doorways and alcoves, built- in cabinets and French doors. The quaint and beautiful historic bungalow is fully appointed with all of the conveniences of a finely furnished and decorated designer home. It has lots of natural sunlight with a spacious floor plan that flows from room to room. There is one bedroom downstairs and another bedroom upstairs that can be used as a guest room, office space, reading nook or quiet retreat. An extensive renovation of the bungalow was recently completed, w
neighborhood_overview: The Fairmount Hills neighborhood is located on the southern tip of downtown Salem. The upscale neighborhood features well maintained historic homes with an incredible variety of architectural styles. Based on its proximity to downtown, Bush Park, Minto-Brown Island, the Riverfront Park, and the Oregon State Capitol, and Willamette University, the Fairmount Hills neighborhood is a highly desirable place to live, stay, relax and play. Fairmount Hills is also home to the Governor's Mansion, Mahonia Hall, which is a half mile from my bungalow. With all of its convenience, natural beauty and historic charm, Fairmount Hills truly offers a premier location and experience.
host_about:
About Sarita and Kevin.  We love traveling, wine tasting, spending precious time together in Oregon, and we work way too hard to restore and renovate beautiful historic homes to preserve their unique and interesting character and craftsmanship.
Sarita Springer and Kevin Kump purchased this Farmhouse in 2018

name: Beautiful Suite Near Downtown & Bush Park
description:
Fully remodeled guest basement apartment within walking distance of downtown Salem, Salem hospital, Willamette University, and Bush Park. Located in the beautiful, historic Bush Park neighborhood. Full kitchen with dishwasher, stove, etc. Perfect for 1-2 people but there is room to comfortably accommodate up to four. We use Airbnb to travel all the time and we built this specifically to be a place that we personally would want to stay.

The space
The unit is 500 sq feet and located in the basement of our 1930's home. You will enter through a back entrance and go down a flight of stairs through a laundry room (the only shared space). Your private apartment door is located at the bottom of the stairs.
Kitchen features full fridge/freezer, stove, dishwasher and all the cooking utensils you will need. The space is large enough to comfortably seat 4 adults.
It is an open plan layout with the kitchen/dining/living area sharing the majority of the space. The
neighborhood_overview: The Bush Park neighborhood is our favorite neighborhood in Salem. It is full of craftsman homes and other early 1920's-30's architecture. It is a nice walking neighborhood. Bush Park is located just 2 blocks away and has beautiful walking trails, playgrounds, and picnic areas.

.4 miles Acme Cafe

1.1 mile Bush Park

6.8 Willamette Valley Vineyards
5.9 Trinity Vineyards

We are located in the heart of the Willamette Valley, which means we are close to many fabulous wineries! The Willamette Valley was recently named
by Time magazine as one of the world's best places to visit for their world famous wines.

Willamette Valley Vineyards voted #1 winery in Oregon, which is located 6 miles down the road. Has gorgeous panoramic views and a fabulous menu.

During the

name: Central Salem Suite with Kitchen
description:
In Central Salem, a cozy guest suite located on the third floor of a charming 1908 home with separate entrance. Walking distance to Salem attractions and amenities. Enjoy the bird's-eye view from the top, have a soak in the spacious bathtub or enjoy your favorite show on Netflix all from the comfort of our guest suite.

We are conveniently located 1.5 miles from I-5. Salem and it's surrounding areas are also home to countless top-notch wineries and an hour from the beautiful Oregon coast.

The space
***Please note: guests must climb two flights of stairs to reach the apartment making our space unsuitable for anyone not comfortable with stairs.***

The guest suite is a charming 650 square foot apartment on the third floor of our home, with a full bathroom and kitchen for your private use.

The space has one larger alcoved room that serves as a bedroom with a queen bed. A second alcoved space can serve as a workspace with a desk and ch
neighborhood_overview:
Our home is centrally located within the downtown Salem area: a few blocks from the State Capitol, the local Farmer's Market, Christo's Pizza, Broadway Coffee, Willamette University, Safeway and within a mile of Salem Hospital, Oregon State Hospital, Oregon State Fairgrounds and the train station. We are about 1.5 miles off of I-5.

Please note, that because of our proximity to downtown and the busy road, you will hear some traffic noise and possibly neighbors from time to time.

Free on-street parking is available. We live in a zoned parking area, so guest passes are available to hang in your car window. We receive only a limited number of parking passes per year and they cost $15 to replace, so they need to be returned at check-out.
host_about: We live and work in Salem, Oregon with our young family, a golden retriever and a constantly fluctuating number of pet rabbits.

name: Oregon Winemakers Beautiful Colonial in Salem
description:
Recently remodeled. 2 story West Salem 2,270 square foot, Colonial home with tall ceilings, located on a quite cult de sac just minutes away from some of Oregon's highest regarded wineries and short to reasonable drive times to so such more.

The space
Located on the edge of Salem city limits and just a few minute farmland, vineyards, orchards, forests land, for biking and scenic drives.
The private backyard is a small oasis which overlooks a small creek at the bottom of the property and unobstructed view of wetlands. A great setting to dine and entertain, relax on the patio, take a hot tub and enjoy watching numerous bird species.

The perfect home base for a great wine country vacation. If you enjoy world class Oregon wine, then consider booking a private tasting at our beautiful Orchard House Estate, home to our Iterum wines. Iterumwines.com.

If high end cuisine and private dining excite you, then consider advance booking with our
neighborhood_overview: 5 minutes from downtown restaurants and shopping, 10 minutes to famed Eola-Amity Hills wineries and Willamette University and Salem Hospital, 20 minutes to Western Oregon University, 45 minutes to Oregon State University and 60 minutes to the beautiful Pacific Ocean Coast and much more...

name: Croisan Creek Cottage, South Salem
description:
Welcome to the Croisan Creek Cottage located in beautiful Salem, Oregon! The cottage is truly a home away from home, containing all the amenities you expect, in a comfortable and low-key environment. Located on a private drive and centrally located. Close to Downtown, Minto Island Park, Services, and walking distance to a local convenience store. The cottage has two wings, each with a private bedroom, a central community area w/ skylight and entertainment center. Did we mention PET friendly?

The space
The cottage is a unique floor plan, designed to have both west and east wings for private guest quarters. The center of the cottage is where the gathering area is, a centralized living room area that connects directly with an open concept kitchen. There is a kitchen is fully stocked and their is a dining room table where there is room for the whole group. The space is functional, but also offers a quaint charm. The most and maybe best aspect of the home is the out
neighborhood_overview: Being the capital city, Salem is a town rich with heritage, and the neighborhoods surrounding the cottage are nothing short of that. In this particular neighborhood, there are new homes, sprinkled amongst older homes (but nothing like our cottage :) and you most certainly find the neighbors pleasant if you decide to take a stroll. The community has a strong sense of neighborhood pride, and the neighbors are families, students and everything in-between. Being the capital city, Salem has a diverse community and strong sense of neighborhood pride. The primary jobs are Government, Non-Profit, Healthcare, Social and Private industries.
host_about: My name is Lillian, and I live in Salem, Oregon with my husband Josh and Golden Retriever, Scooter. Professionally, I am a residential real estate agent, representing custom home builders and Buyers throughout the Willamette Valley. I have a passion for travel, adventure and experiencing all that life has to offer!

name: The Little Blue House (in central Salem, Oregon)
description:
The Little Blue House is in downtown Salem near the capitol. 2 blocks from a grocery store with a cafe and restaurant 2 blocks away. No stairs to enter! Long stays are easy with the washer&dryer and ample space. On a quiet cul de sac w. a private driveway. You will have a full kitchen, bright living room with a dedicated workspace and fast Wifi, a newer TV and a private patio. It's an ideal location for walks in downtown Salem. Close to dozens of Oregon Pinot wineries. 50 miles to the Pacific!

The space
The Little Blue House is lately remodeled and spotless. It is decorated with a funky vintage Salem and Oregon vibe. The amenities include a washer and dryer and fully equipped kitchen with a full sized stove and a dishwasher. The queen bed is memory foam bed with silky bamboo sheets. There's a private, shady patio for relaxing.

Guest access
We'll send entry instructions a few days prior to arrival via the Airbnb app. There is a two pag
neighborhood_overview: Close walking distance of the Oregon State Capitol&Park, Deepwood Estate&Gardens(1893) Bush House Museum(1878) the Willamette Heritage Center with houses to tour including the Jason Lee House, the oldest wood frame house in Oregon (1840-41) and the Thomas Kay Woolen Mill museum and Willamette University (founded in 1842). See Salem's historic downtown with restaurants and shops galore! Hiking and biking is easy from The Little Blue House, so are visiting famous Oregon Pinot wineries and many local breweries.
host_about: My husband and I are mostly retired. We don’t do organized tours but prefer to travel on our own schedule so Airbnb places are perfect for us. In 2018, we purchased a "fixer" and after working on it for a year became hosts.  We believe in the Airbnb community and know that it's a great way for us and others to travel the world.

name: The Studio on Cottage
description:
-Cozy basement studio apartment
-Centrally located, quick access to 1-5 and Salem amenities.
-One queen bed, plus small futon that can accommodate a child.
-Kitchenette (microwave, tea kettle, mini fridge, Nespresso maker, etc.)
-Great tile shower with large bathtub
-Coffee/Tea Provided

The space
Our basement was remodeled in 2017 to create this guest suite for our friends and family. The guest studio entrance is around the back of our house and is yours alone.

Our space has one queen bed, but can also accommodate a child on the small futon.

The kitchenette is a great spot for making a cup of coffee or heating up leftovers from a local restaurant. There is a microwave, small fridge, Nespresso coffee maker, and an electric kettle. You'll also find a list of our favorite walkable restaurants once you arrive. There is much food to enjoy nearby!

There is a small table for those needing a place to set up a
neighborhood_overview:
Our house is on a tree-lined street just a few minutes from downtown. Our block is full of families, and it is common to see neighbors gathered on porches together or kids playing along the sidewalk between houses.

From our place you can easily walk to restaurants, coffee shops, movie theaters, the Salem Farmers Market, the Oregon State Capitol, and shopping downtown.
host_about:
I'm a Northwest grown girl, who loves to see other parts of the world.

I'm a mom of two boys. I love coffee, red wine, exploring a new city, gardening and reading. 

Most of my work has centered around youth development and social justice.

name: Quiet, Licensed W. Salem Room for Travelers
description:
In West Salem, less than 4 miles from Salem Hospital, Oregon State Hospital and Willamette University. 2.5 miles from Riverfront Carousel. Hosted by semi-retired female, who has a friendly cat. Room has blackout shade, an air filter and a white noise machine if needed for guest who work overnights. Please contact host directly for pet friendly requests.

The space
Guests have full access to kitchen, washer and dryer.

Guest access
Guest have full access to the shared living areas of the home.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood in a very nice part of West Salem. Very convenient to different shopping and restaurant options. I’ve hosted many travel nurses, relocating professionals and people finishing their education.
host_about: I’m an outgoing, semi retired, grandmother of 2. I have room to spare so after moving here from Southern California I thought I’d give this a try.  Really my daughter talked me into it and I figure that if I keep the guest room full she’ll be jealous and want to visit more. I’m kidding. Maybe. I love cruising and the color purple, I can’t live without music, People Magazine and garlic (but don’t worry, the kitchen doesn’t smell like it), I love law, medical and crimes shows. I’m still searching for the best foods of Salem, I do miss a few favorite dishes.

name: Capitol City Retreat
description:
Our home is a quiet, restful haven in a pleasant South Salem neighborhood! Our home is bathed in natural light made possible by the amazingly large windows throughout. Several windows open to the outdoors and a beautiful view of the native trees that hug the edge of the yard dropping away to a small ravine. Robins sing as they survey their realm from atop the trees while squirrels and a myriad of birds scurry and flit about enjoying their natural habitat!

The space
Guests have their own private, spacious bathroom just a few steps down the hall from their bedroom.

Guest access
We offer one free load of laundry per week or once per reservation if less than a week. Thereafter the fee per load is $5 and guest provides own laundry detergent.

Cooking in the kitchen is allowed by special arrangement. Please ask upon arrival. We prefer minimal kitchen use, i.e. sandwiches, salads, etc. in other words, use of oven or stove for heating up
neighborhood_overview: We are located in a quiet, safe, inviting neighborhood of South Salem just minutes from down town, Commercial and Liberty Street, giving guests easy access to groceries, restaurants, places of interest with I-5 an easy 15 minutes away.
host_about:
We sold our ranch on the Red River in N.E. Texas in 2013 and headed north to the Portland, Oregon area where 2 of our children were living. We became enamored with the smaller city of Salem, Oregon and chose it as our next home allowing us to be closer to our children and my parents. 
My husband, Earl, and I both love to cook and I have a baked goods business out of our home.
Earl is a coffee perfectionist and our guests always get a fresh ground, fresh aero press cup of coffee as early as they need it.
Before moving to Texas in 1990 we lived in Homer, Alaska on the Kenai Peninsula for 20 years. Earl worked on the North Slope at Prudhoe Bay and was on the original crew that sent the first oil down the Alaska pipeline in 1978. 
Earl had always wanted to farm so off we went to Texas to raise beef cattle, soybeans and wheat. 
We love to travel and have enjoyed several road trips between Texas and Oregon! 
We love hosting and having the opportunity to meet so many different personalities and learn about different parts of our world and how we all fit together in it. We have the same attitude toward staying as guests. Airbnb is the perfect ambassador for our world.
We love the Airbnb adventure and we invite you to be a part of it!
We recently moved from our first home in Salem, a four bedroom, four bath apartment where we had two Airbnb listings. We now have a beautiful home at which we offer one lovely guest room and private bath.

name: 1941 Craftsman in Salem  w/ Private Backyard Patio
description:
This remodeled 1941 Craftsman home, settled in the heart of Salem, will ease your mind and soothe your soul! Feel right at home with new comfy mattresses, textiles and amenities. Thoughtfully designed with coastal decor and soothing color pallet to create a calming environment.

The space
Throughout the years we have stayed in many airbnb's and understand the little things that make a place an enjoyable stay. With that thought, we have designed this home with comfort, cleanliness and style in mind. Our goal is to make sure you have everything you need and expect as if you were at home.

This house is a dedicated vacation rental. You wont find any personal belongings or surprises lurking in closets, drawers, and cabinets during your stay.

The house is equipped with a heating system and a fire place for the cold winter, and fans in the bedrooms, a ceiling fan in the living room for the warm summer time. Fire wood is not included, however it is a
neighborhood_overview: Perfect location! 1 hour from the gorgeous Oregon Coast, 1 hour from Portland, 45 minutes from the famous Mt Hood National Forest and only 5 minutes away from the Willamette River and Riverfront City Park! It's also conveniently located 5 min from Willamette University, the Oregon State Capitol, Downtown Salem, the State Fairgrounds, and Interstate 5.

name: Cozy, convenient room in Salem
description:
Welcome to our home in Salem! We are located between downtown and Lancaster Drive, and are surrounded by parks, grocery stores, and shops. We offer a private and cozy room with it's own entry from the front of the house. Access to the laundry room, kitchen, a shared bathroom, and the living room are also included. The home is within driving distance to the Oregon Coast, Portland, wineries, and some of the best hiking spots you could ever ask for.

We would love to welcome you as our guest!

The space
The room has a separate entry from the front of the house with a keypad door, meaning you won't have to worry about carrying around a key! It also features a cozy full sized bed, TV with Netflix, desk, and closet space. You are more than welcome to use the kitchen and all of the cooking supplies in it, as well as the fridge and pantry. A washer and dryer are also available for you to use. Beginning February 1, 2021, the bathroom is shared with our one roomma
neighborhood_overview: This is an older neighborhood outside of downtown Salem. With big tall oak and maple trees and wonderful older homes nearby, the neighborhood has beautiful falls with red, orange and yellow leaves falling from the trees. The area is unique and historic, providing some great moments of thinking “woah, what a cool house!” as you drive by.
host_about: I am a real estate agent who enjoys watching and playing sports, cooking, learning, and seeing the world out around me. I love to meet and talk to all sorts of different people from all sorts of different backgrounds and experiences.

name: The Bunkhouse
description:
Located close to Englewood Park, the Bunkhouse is a unique, cabin-like dwelling.

Some say smaller than a tiny house, at 8x8 ft, the Bunkhouse still has all the necessities for living:
*dry toilet (search Loveable Loo for dry toilet information)
* mini kitchen - cold or hot water in jugs or water dispenser, mini fridge, induction hot plate, toaster oven, sink, all necessary utensils
* elevated twin futon bed
* easy chair and TV tray for a table
* NO running water or SHOWER

The space
It's amazing what little space some of us actually need to be comfortable. At a cozy 8x8 feet, The Bunkhouse is a place to see that for yourself. It's a precious little space with original art, good books, a view into the tall trees, and all the basics for a uniquely comfortable stay in Salem. If basics for you include running water and a shower, however, this is not your place. This is more of a camping style experience.

Some guests ha
neighborhood_overview:
Englewood is a beautiful historic neighborhood surrounded by towering Douglas Fir, Western Red Cedar, and Oregon White Oak.
Joe Mocha Coffee Shop is a few blocks away, Safeway and the Oregon State Hospital are about a half mile, while downtown Salem, Willamette University, and the Amtrak Station are an easy mile-or-so walk.
host_about: I am an actively engaged, retired restaurant owner/operator and community college instructor.  Currently, my son and 8 year old granddaughter live in the front part of the house. No dogs live here at the moment but one may appear at any time. For now, Oscar, my 13 year old cat, rules the roost.

name: Charming stay near everything!
description:
Charming stay near everything!

Right around the corner from Bush Park, many guests choose this stay because of the walking and bikeability to Salem Health, downtown, Willamette University and the state capital.

Also very close to Salem Hospital, Garmin, and Morrow Crane.

The space
This room is quite large and is set up with the ability to function as a small studio apartment. While guests are more than welcome to share the living space and kitchen of the main floor, this room has a mini fridge and toaster oven so one can opt out of using the shared full kitchen if desired.

Other things to note
We Airbnb 3 other bedrooms in the house. This room is upstairs and shares a bathroom with one other bedroom.
It is our largest room and set up to function to some extent as a micro studio. There is a small prep space, mini fridge w/freezer and small toaster oven.

We live on site in the fully finished basement apa

name: Mid-Century-Modern w/Views The Mulberry House
description:
The Mulberry House is an exceptional piece of postmodern sensibility. The Pacific Northwest architect Pietro Belluschi's spirit lives on in its design and function, and the passion behind that continues to impact those who step inside this home. It is functional and lacks unnecessary adornment. This house is more like a retreat, a spiritual retreat.

The space
Renovated to preserve the integrity of the original home builders' vision. The Mulberry House offers a contemporary and tasteful environment with all the modern conveniences of today's travel world.

Guest access
Front door with lockbox key for self check-in. In addition to the front door there is a carport side door with ramp and not steps to enter with same key as front door.

Other things to note
In addition to listing the house as not suitable for children, I do not rent to families with children under the age of nine because of safety issues. The staircase bal
neighborhood_overview: Located in the western facing hills of Candelaria in Salem Heights. This mid-century neighborhood is merely a 5-minute drive to all the splendor downtown Salem has to offer.
host_about:
Health conscious, Yoga teacher, gym program, outdoor activities. 
Spontaneous & Adventurous. Travel to mystic places to relax & grow keeps me balanced and dynamic. Would rather have a role model with people who have parallel interests and are driven & matured into who they are meant to be. 

Sports; Ashtanga Yoga Teacher, Swimmer, Rock climbing, Water-ski, Gym, & Lambretta Scooters. Obtained my Advanced PADI Scuba certificate to get one step closer to that next paradise vacation.

I would enjoy sunsets even if I were blind.... You can feel a sunset.

PADI System; Advanced Scuba Diver Certification. The world leader in the educational development of scuba diving professionals and enthusiasts.

name: Quiet Cozy Duplex, Great Location
description:
This quiet neighborhood is easy walking distance to Bush Pasture Park, Best Little Steakhouse and mini golf, Dutch Bro’s Coffee, Whites Restaurant, a coffee shop and much more.

It’s less than a mile to downtown shopping and eateries, and Riverfront Park and the connected Minto Brown Park, with a dog park and miles of walking or biking trails.

A few miles farther will take you to the wonderful Oregon Gardens in charming little city of Silverton. Or keep going to beautiful Silver Falls Park

The space
This half of our duplex has been completely remodeled in 2021 with new flooring, new kitchen, new windows and window coverings, lighting and paint throughout.

Guest access
Guests have access to all the space inside the duplex, including the garage, the front yard, and half of the back yard area.

Other things to note
We have a twin size roll-away bed available. This can be used for that extra perso
neighborhood_overview: This is a friendly neighborhood where you’ll see lots of joggers, bike riders and dog walkers. Take a stroll on a nice day.
host_about: My husband, Fadd, and I have owned rentals for over 40 years (although we are still just kids).  This is our first try at short term rentals but we are enjoying it very much.  We live just a few minutes from the duplex so we can be there soon for any emergency or problem.

name: Our Friends &  Family Peaceful  Palace Home
description:
Welcome home to all future guests. Self Key Box's 24/7Access. Enjoy a new fully completed upgraded home. Guest enjoy a new modern feel, with classic era of the 1930's. Included 1st an 2nd story of home. (1926sq) Fully stocked Kitchen, Washer/ Dryer, Dishwasher, Stove. Duel Coffee Maker. *Free Coffee Keurig Pods*. Indoor Hammock. Classic outdoor Porch Swing. Large Patio Deck Table/ Chairs. Gas/Charcoal BBQ’s WiFi, 2- HD TV, DVD Player. 1 King Bed 1st floor 2-Queen Bedrooms 2-floor.

The space
Relax and enjoy. 1/2 Story included (1900 square feet) Includes the following: 3- Full Bedrooms, 1 Full Bathroom Downstairs 1-Kingsize Bedroom downstairs 2- Full Queen size bedrooms Upstairs. Complete furnished Kitchen, electric Stove with all utensils to cook meals. Kitchen area has Full size Washer an Dryer. Microwave/ Coffee Pot/ Pods appliance. Free Coffee Pods provided or bring an brew your favorite coffee. Dining room / living room has large table/
neighborhood_overview: Salem, Oregon fairgrounds is less then a couple minutes from home, can walk to it from our home. Salem Hospital is less than 10 minutes away, also downtown Salem less than 10 minutes. Be sure to eat at the New IN/ Out Burgers just open in Keizer Station, less than 10 minutes from home.
host_about:
Someone who happen's to be married to the most beautiful woman in the world. 
 Live, Laugh, and please Love someone, somewhere today.  Goodness knows, we each need more of that on the earth today, tomorrow and every day of the year.

PS  Try giving a Hug to someone today, if not a Hug try a Smile that always work best for me. :)  Lisa/ I wish to say Thank you in advance for your friendly visit.

name: Bombshell basement
description:
This is the perfect place for a traveling nurse with the Salem hospital or month to month starts.
This is a daylight basement studio in a quiet neighborhood in s. salem, only 2 miles from downtown. This is a nice unit for one to 2 people for long stay or a tighter stay for group of 4 persons. There is a kitchenette with a full size fridge and a cook top with toaster, coffee maker, and microwave included. Large back yard for the kids to run and play. Fire available for summer time

The space
This is my home and I do rent out the upstairs when I'm not home so there may be some overlap during your stay but I try not to. The upstairs is off limits.

Guest access
There are stairs to the main level but they are off limits unless discussed prior to climbing
neighborhood_overview:
Quiet neighborhood just 1 mile from cafes, restaurants and bars. 2 miles to Salem hospital

A quiet cemetary is just 100 yards away
host_about: I love sharing my house with people from all over the world.  I take great pride is hosting and providing a great experience for my guests.  Whether you come for an evening or for an extended stay you are welcome to ask for any odds or ends to make my place what you need.

name: Englewood Loft
description:
Welcome to the heart of Salem! This studio apartment is located above our home, just outside the historic district of Salem's downtown.

The space
Upstairs studio with private entrance. Single parking space off road available. Keyless entry for easy check in. This quirky Englewood Loft studio-style rental is fully equipped with all the comforts of home. Hiking and waterfalls are as near as the next town over, the coast is a little more than an hour away, and skiing in the winter is just over the mountain pass.

Relaxation is our specialty. We are pros at chilling and taking it easy and chances are you deserve it. Furnished with a memory foam queen-size bed, this well decorated loft will be a much appreciated treat after a day of walking our great hiking trails. A full bathroom and kitchen packed with all the comforts of home. Hang out and watch a large flat screen TV, with a Roku to connect to all your streaming accounts. Cook a nice meal in the fully
neighborhood_overview: The loft is situated in the historic Englewood Neighborhood. Walking distance to Englewood Park with walking trail, and only a 5 minute drive to downtown. Close to the Oregon State Capitol, fairgrounds, Willamette University, Salem Health Hospital, Oregon State Hospital, Chemeketa Community College, and Corban University.
host_about: I love hot tea, hiking, plants, and crafting!

name: Willamette Valley Hideaway!
description:
Your family will be close to everything when you stay at this centrally-located place! Close to Willamette University, downtown Salem, Willamette Valley Vineyards. Just an hour from the beach, Eugene and Portland.
Enjoy the outdoor pool from May-Sept fully heated clean above ground pool! Or cozy up by the fire with friends and family in the open concept living area. Our home is clean, and dog friendly! There are 4 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Quiet, safe friendly neighborhood!

The space
Welcome to our home! We have 4 bedrooms and can sleep up to 7 people, we can add a blow up mattress if you need more beds for 8-9 people.
host_about:
Hi my name is Jenni, I live in salem with my 2 daughters (7 and 14) and my wonderful husband. We love to spend our weekends "seizing the moment". We moved into our home in Decemeber of 2017. I love decorating the house and finding ways to make it more inviting for our friends and family and guests. 


We love doing Air bnb and sharing our home with families that need a comfortable home while they are traveling to Salem.

name: LARGE Upstairs 2 Bed 2 Bath condo Creek View!
description:
With the creek view, you feel like you are camping but with the convenience of being in the City Center. 2nd floor unit with 1 set of stairs to access the unit. Private unit at end of building (only one neighbor)

You will have one assigned parking spot and a second spot may be available upon request.

The space
Over 1000 SF! Sunny and bright two bedrooms, two bathrooms, full kitchen, large living room, Creekside condo just blocks from downtown Salem. Wonderful view of historic Mill Creek and large balcony overlooking the creek. Reserved parking . Three blocks from Salem Center Mall, five blocks from State Capital and six from Willamette University. This is in an apartment building, it is on the second floor so you will have a neighbor below and to the side of you. You will hear other people which is part of life when sharing walls. If that is not something you want please look for a home that would better suit you. Thanks for understanding!
neighborhood_overview:
Check out the guidebook section of this site, we have a lot of fun things to do, see and eat!

You are in the downtown area and though it is very safe (the new police station is being built only 4 blocks away), this is a metro area and there are two homeless support facilities in the downtown area so you will see the people they support. We have never had any issues or any of our guests, but it is a part of life in many cities and you should be aware of it.
host_about: Love to travel and spend time with my family and our dog!  Grew up in Oregon and loved coming back after college.
