name: Quaint room in Bush Park classic
description:
Natural light filled room!

Located on the main level of the home, this quaint room feels bright even when it's gloomy outside.
Outfitted with a desk and has a large closet with plenty of space for luggage, the closet is even big enough to fit a pack 'n' play for infant or toddler to sleep in their own "room".

Shares a bathroom with one other bedroom. The living room, dining area, and kitchen are all shared spaces.

The space
Shares a bathroom. The living room, dining area, and kitchen are all shared spaces.

Guest access
Street parking is available right next to or very close to the house. Driveway is available as a loading/unloading zone.

Bush Park is just a half-block away. Salem Hospital, Riverfront Park, Willamette University, State Capitol, and downtown are all within walking distance.
Don't feel like walking? Public transit stops are close by, or its a cheap LYFT or Uber ride away.
host_about: Love hiking, camping, gardening, our adorable dogs (don't travel with us) and all kinds of delicious hobbies such as wine making, pickling and bread making.

name: Large Family Room, Perfect Home for the Holidays!
description:
The entire property is yours. Spacious living room and kitchen. Backyard firepit. Four flat screen TVs. Fully stocked kitchen, fast wifi, quiet workspace.

Right off the i5 Exit.
Huge parking space.

Gather the whole family, set up shop for a business trip or just enjoy a quiet retreat

*Any questions? Just message me!

The space
I love using AirBnB for local and international travel.

HOWEVER... I get frustrated when the basic stuff is missing from a place; so, I know exactly the things you want too:

- CLEAN (This is the golden rule, not to be broken)
- High Speed WiFi
- Smart TV + Netflix (you can sign into any other account you have, Amazon Prime, Hulu, etc.)
- Lots of natural light + well lit at night
- Quiet, private home to rest or work.
- Huge private parking area
- Fully Equipped Kitchen with everything you need to cook
- A place centrally located to downtown, r
neighborhood_overview:
I love my neighborhood because it is so close to everything you need. It is walking distance from Five Guys, Taco Bell, McDonalds, Pietro's Pizza, and many others.

The Willamette Town Center Mall with Regal Theater, Best Buy, Hobby Lobby and Red Robbins are all a few short minutes drive away.

It is a quick drive right downtown. Where you have riverfront park. I really enjoy grabbing a drink at Isaac's Coffee, Gov Cup or Broadway Coffee and going for a stroll. Broadway has a fireplace and amazing outdoor seating.

I love renting bikes with Zagster ($3 an hour!!!) and biking from downtown, through river front park, across the bike bridge into Minto Brown Island park. Worth it!

How far away is your AirBnB from...

- Salem Hospital, 3.2 miles
- Riverfront Park, 3.2 miles
- Market st. i5 exit, .5 miles
- Downtown, 2.8 miles
- Taco Bell, .5 miles
- Walgreens, .6 miles
- Bush Park, 3.3 miles
host_about:
I have traveled to 17 countries: Spain, England, Nepal, Thailand, Cambodia, Singapore, Mexico, Canada, Honduras, Costa Rica and Nicaragua. Oh and Scotland, South Africa, Mozambique, Oman and UAE. 

I love experiencing new things and meeting new people of the world. I learned Spanish when I lived in Mexico.

Lately I have been getting into loose leaf green tea.
Podcasts: Reply All, Heavy Weight, Another Kingdom (fiction)
TV: The Good Place, Schitt's Creek, The Office (forever and ever)


**Please give me your travel recommendations, I always appreciate tips.

name: Salem's R & R Home. “Great for Traveling workers!”
description:
Come stay at our sweet townhouse in the middle of Salem! Super easy parking is free. Our lovely landscaping welcomes you with seasonal flowers and herbs. Our townhouse is open, bright & clean with comfy furniture and big beds upstairs. The kitchen is stocked with the basics including spices and oil to get you started. Kitchen table seats 6 or have dinner outside on the patio. It's set up for both! Sleeps 6 people Max 2 vehicles per city code, no animals, smoking, vaping or mj.

The space
Our townhome sits on a simple street on a beautifully landscaped lot and offers guests a quiet and restful stay. With all 3 bedrooms and a full bathroom upstairs, there is a great separation of space and places for everyone to spread out. The main level has the wide open spaces of the living room, dining room and kitchen. The living room has comfy seating and a wall mounted flat screen tv and 220+
channels to choose from! The kitchen has all the appliances needed t
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is well established, circa 1940.  Many older houses line the streets , not  historical and certainly wise.   Our townhouse is the youngest kid on the block.  Our neighbors include a friendly neighbor in a house next door and a commercial company on the other side.  It is usually very quiet as few cars use our street.
host_about: I am retired. Also a master gardener and love to bake. I am a wife, mother and Grandmother, and love every minute of it.

name: Luxurious modern retreat in Downtown w/ pool
description:
Enjoy the refreshing modern styles in this newly renovated guest suite with in-ground pool.
Located half-mile from Salem Hospital makes it a perfect option for traveling medical staff.
Downtown shops and restaurants are less than one mile away, along with River Front Park. About half-mile from the Amtrack train station and the Oregon State Capital Building.

The space
The Guest Suite is located behind the main house. Guests will have total privacy and occupancy of the one bedroom one bathroom unit. Washer and Dryer are available in the unit.
neighborhood_overview: The Grant Neighborhood has many 100+-year-old homes and its a short walk to the State Capital Building and Saturday Market!
host_about: I'm a local Real Estate Professional looking to extend some wonderful space to fellow travelers. I strive to maintain a peaceful environment and overall provide a comfortable and warm place to stay. I look forward to meeting you and hope you find my place inviting and enjoyable!!

name: Beautiful Fully Furnished 3 bedroom 2 bath home
description:
Fully furnished 3 bedroom 2 bath home close to Downtown Salem. Walkable neighborhood, quiet, private, fully fenced yard with beautiful landscaping front and back. Steps from restaurants, groceries and buses to downtown, hospital, Willamette University. Available mid-Jan for one-month and longer stays.

The space
This is a well-furnished, fully equipped home with a king bedroom, a queen bedroom, a single bedroom (or office) and 2 bathrooms (1 tub/shower and 1 shower). There is a large, light living and dining room with views to front and back yards, a patio door to beautiful back yard and a marble fireplace with gas. The eat -in kitchen is newly renovated with gas stove and stainless appliances. There is a deep, one-car garage and ample off-street parking.

name: Quiet, comfy, licensed West Salem room to stay.
description:
In West Salem, less than 4 miles from Salem Hospital, Oregon State Hospital and Willamette University. 2.5 miles from Riverfront Carousel. Perfect if you're relocating for work, on an extended visit or work assignment. Hosted by semi-retired female, who has a friendly cat. Immaculately clean. Please contact host directly for pet friendly requests. Fantastic reviews means this will be a great stay for you! Stays over 30 days won’t have OR lodging tax

The space
Guests have full access to kitchen, washer and dryer.

Guest access
There’s a living room, back patio, kitchen and dining spaces

Other things to note
Very easy check-in, keypad to access the home.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet neighborhood in a very nice part of West Salem. Very convenient to different shopping and restaurant options. I’ve hosted many travel nurses, relocating professionals and people finishing their education.
host_about: I’m an outgoing, semi retired, grandmother of 2. I have room to spare so after moving here from Southern California I thought I’d give this a try.  Really my daughter talked me into it and I figure that if I keep the guest room full she’ll be jealous and want to visit more. I’m kidding. Maybe. I love cruising and the color purple, I can’t live without music, People Magazine and garlic (but don’t worry, the kitchen doesn’t smell like it), I love law, medical and crimes shows. I’m still searching for the best foods of Salem, I do miss a few favorite dishes.

name: Bright 1-Bedroom Cottage in West Salem's Downtown
description:
Charming Single-Level House in West Salem's Edgewater District is close to Coffee, Restaurants, Brews, Groceries, and more!

Long driveway and single-car garage can comfortably park 3 vehicles (1 in the garage, 2 in tandem on the driveway).

Nearby pedestrian paths connect the neighborhood to the Union Street Railroad Bridge, Riverfront Park, Downtown Salem, Minto Brown Island, and Wallace Marine Park.

City of Salem License "23-104233-00"

The space
Our home is charming and comfortable, but is older and has some personality quirks and noises.

A newer ductless heat pump works well and provides heating and cooling.

name: 1950's Charm-Great for long/short term. Come stay!
description:
Great area in Salem! Minutes from downtown, quiet street, walk to Bush park, very comfortable neighborhood. This 1950's house has 2 bedrooms with ample closet space, an office with door to the backyard and deck, spacious living room with a cozy gas fireplace, smart TV, garage with washer and dryer accessed through the kitchen, gas stove and many other amenities. The house is easy to get to from I5, about an hour from Portland. Perfect for a 1-2 couples or a small family. Most everything is new!

The space
You will have the whole house to yourself! There are 2 bedrooms, one with a queen bed and the other with a full size bed. There are dressers and closets with wood hangers in each. Both rooms have night stands with lamps and nightlights. Extra bedding can be found in the closets or the linen closet in the hall.

The office has a generous desk and chair, sitting area and a door to the backyard deck. I love the sunlight this room gets. The office closet h
neighborhood_overview:
The house is 5 minutes from Willamette University, 6 minutes to the Capital building, downtown Salem and Salem Hospital.

Bush's Pasture park is about a 15 minute very pleasant walk from the house. Minto-Brown Island Park is about 10 minutes drive away.

The stunning Oregon coast is about an hour and 15 minutes away and is a must see if you have never been.

Mt Hood skiing, snowboarding and winter activities are about 2 hours away. This area is also beautiful in the summer.

The house is about 55 minutes from downtown Portland where you can find all the big city attractions.

Here is a link to some local Salem sights:

https://link.oregonlive.com/view/5e8c7cf20bbeac2af433d63aeazfc.1fm/4f30e394
host_about:
I love to travel, at least before Covid.  I went on a 2 week  cruise through the Panama Canal, Central America and just touching South America most recently, and prior to that I spent a month in the Greek Isles. I have been to Hungary, England, Germany,  Scotland and Italy, and have also been to Thailand, Costa Rica, Ireland, Belgium, Spain, New Zealand, Mexico, Portugal, Canada and more. Lately I’ve been sticking closer to home- San Francisco, Phoenix, AZ and the Oregon coast.
During the warmer months I like to get on the river kayaking-flat water and garden. My house is full of books which you are welcome to. I like tea, rocks, playing pool, spicy food, getting together with family and friends. Laughter is important to me. 
I am an RN. I eat a vegetarian diet but have no problem if you do not.
I grew up in Portland, lived away for 7 years and returned when I started my family. I raised my 3 daughters essentially on my own with a little help from my folks and siblings. They are grown now-my oldest living in Alaska, the other 2 in Oregon- the youngest is only a couple miles away. 
I am love being an airbnb host! I work from home so am available most of the time. 
 Smoking is OK on the back patio and front porch if desired, away from open doors and windows. 
The Portland metro area has much to offer and I like to get out for the experience. I am open but know how to give people their space. Feel free to ask me anything. 
I enjoy helping people, fun, new faces and places. I like games and friendly competition, movies, being outside, and the feel of a good book in my hands. I've lately started watching some shows on HBO, Netflix and Hulu after a long hiatus from TV. I have a soft spot for sci-fi and fantasy-don't judge! Traveling is important to me.
I have an old, sweet boxer named Gypsy who will likely want to greet you, but sleeps most of the time.
My daughters come to visit sometimes with their husbands and pups too.

name: 1000 sq ft Studio apartment. Washer/dryer. Parking
description:
The Grace House Guest suite is a basement apartment with private entrance and off street parking. Conveniently located close to Capitol, University, Hospital, Convention Center, Fairgrounds and I-5. Situated in a quiet historical neighborhood with beautiful trees and architecture. You have access to the entire 1000 sq ft space which includes a Cal King bed, full size sleeper sofa, kitchenette, bathroom, washer/dryer, and a great garden patio seating area.

The space
Over 1000 sq ft of relaxed living in this 1928 Tudor guest suite. You're only a few blocks away from the farmers market, state capitol, riverfront park, and downtown. You're also conveniently location close to I-5 and 99W. The space features a roomy cal king bed, full size memory foam sleeper sofa, electric fireplace for added warmth and ambiance, full size washer & dryer, shower, brass wet bar with kitchenette, fridge, ice maker, microwave, toaster and induction burner. The copper eat at bar mak
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is fairly quiet and older. Most homes were build in the 1920's - 1930's. There are some beautiful homes in the area and it's quite lovely to take a morning walk. It's a short walk to the farmers market. Joe Mocha is a great cafe a block away which sells coffee and breakfast/lunch items. There are also two convenience stores and a local bar within walking distance. Downtown is a short stroll and is a great opportunity to see the many cherry blossom trees Salem is so well known for. The downtown restaurants are vibrant with excellent food and craft cocktails. Down on the waterfront, you'll find a fantastic park, a beautiful bridge and our famous carousel. Lots of great activities can be found very close by.

Nearby parks: Minto Brown, Bush Pasture, Riverfront

If you're looking for great wine, food or activity recommendations, I'm happy to assit as I have great relationships with many in the area and know they will take amazing care of you!

name: The Garden Flat at Botaneity, Oregon wine country
description:
Inspired by the quaint apartments we've visited in Paris, our charming, private garden flat in the Willamette Valley is surrounded by 30+ wineries and is a 5 minute drive to downtown restaurants & shops, the riverwalk and Willamette University. Take a day trip to the coast or relax & enjoy a bottle of wine at the flat curated by your host, a local winemaker! Our c.1870 farmhouse welcomes you with a private entrance & features exposed brick, kitchenette, & environmentally-conscious amenities.

The space
Your hosts, a local winemaker and a local artist, invite you to relax in Oregon wine country. Our thoughtful amenities include: wine list curated by your host, organic Avocado mattress topper, vegan Aveda shower products, and more. The space also features a gallery wall with rotating local artists and art available for purchase.

You're invited to join us seasonally at our on-site farmstand for hot coffee, fresh baked goods & gifts.

name: Century House Maple Room bright and spacious
description:
The Maple Room is spacious and bright, and on the back side of the house, with lots of trees. One step away from a totally refurbished bathroom. The Maple Room has its own heating and cooling unit. Across the hall is a sitting/play/reading/eating space, with adjacent kitchenette. Kitchenette has full fridge, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, rice cooker, crockpot, and induction cooktop/pans. The refrigerator will be well stocked with a significant morning "snack" of fruit, pastry, protein.

The space
There's a mini forest out back, with delightful shade, Adirondacks, a fire pit, a very special swing, and a napping house!
neighborhood_overview: So much to see within a mile from Century House: the state Capitol,  Willamette University, Bush Park and rose garden, historic museums, restaurants, shopping, and the Willamette River!
host_about:
Bicycling is my passion and my past-time, as well as my recipe for physical and emotional well-being.  Most recently, I have enjoyed “packing down” my bike with gear and heading down the road - for an overnight, or three, or three weeks.  This gives a whole new meaning to “bed and breakfast”.

When I’m not cycling, I’m usually busy cooking, cleaning, reading, sewing or watching the trees and flowers grow in my little forest; and, of course, accommodating the many fascinating guests who find their way to Century House from all corners of the globe.  My life is truly enriched by the diversity of perspectives and experiences that guests bring with them.

I confess, my favorite guests may be the children. With a full career of working in the field of early childhood, I never cease to be wowed by the uninhibited enthusiasm, curiosity, and resilience of the younger generation.  I am thrilled and dedicated to being a family-friendly business.

Another of my endeavors is the promotion/education of good nutrition.  I might be seen pedaling to a local farm to fill my packs with broccoli for the local food bank  - or, with fresh kale for a morning smoothie :-).  Don’t worry, there is still room for a brownie or an oatmeal cookie on the dessert tray.  After all, we need our dark chocolate, and our oatmeal, right?

name: Hidden Treasure - A Private Guest Suite
description:
Forget your worries in this spacious and serene location.

The space
Our guest suite is located in the lower back part of our home. The secluded outdoor space is serene in a beautiful neighborhood. There is a private entrance into a spacious and open living area with a gas fireplace. There’s a large TV with Cable, Netflix and excellent WiFi. We have hosted friends and guests here for years. We decided to upgrade by adding a full kitchen and laundry room to open it to the Airbnb community.

Guest access
There is limited parking in our neighborhood we have off street parking for you on our RV pad. We also live on a unique one-way loop, so be sure to follow the posted signs.

Other things to note
Living in proximity to many vineyards we love to enjoy the local vintages. In fact we are part of a very small private wine group call ‘Selah’. We have a friend who is a gifted wine maker. We pool resources to buy local grapes and
neighborhood_overview: We live in a nice, quiet neighborhood. The road is a one-way loop of nicer homes. Because the subdivision was built on a hill there is an upper and a lower part of the loop. Please be aware of one-way signs and no-parking signs because you can only park on one side of the street.  Our home has an RV pad that we will leave open for off-street parking.
host_about: My wife and I have been married for 37 years. We live in the city where I grew up, Salem, Oregon. We’re both very active and love to workout at the gym. We like to travel, but don’t do it a lot. Family and friends are very important to us, so we love to get together with our community.

name: Near I5: Spacious tent & cots with outdoor seating
description:
We wanted to host the kind of space we like when we travel: affordable, simple, safe, kid-friendly, and pet-friendly.

Our spacious Coleman tent is set up with cots, a table, lamp, and flashlights for two people, but you can scale up and add more adults, children, or friendly pets. There are two comfortable outdoor seating areas. You will have access to a bathroom designated for your use, though it is accessible through the house - meaning our kids and beagle may greet you.

Welcome, traveler!

The space
Think of this as a convenient camping experience: you have a site but it's not remote, you have a tent but don't have to fuss with setting it up, and you have access to a bathroom but there are no giant mosquitos lurking inside. It's a simple, clean stay in a tent.

The tent price includes cots & tent linens for two adults. The adult sized cot measures 75" long, 35" wide, and 17" tall. You can add up to two spaces at an increased nigh

host_about:
Hello! We are a book, lego, art, and food-loving family of four: Stephanie, James, Oliver, & Lincoln. Well, we are five when at home with our four-legged family member, Otis. :) 

We fancy ourselves growing travelers and took a break from travel in 2020, but we came back strong with a 33-day road trip in 2021 and a 37-day road trip in 2022. We have experienced 20 national parks together!

Traveling with kids has really changed our desire to have and offer options for affordable and safe travel. We used to travel and host on CouchSurfing, but we are looking to expand our travels with Airbnb for more family-centered travel experiences.

name: Monthly Downtown Salem Loft Apt. by Salemstays.com
description:
1,100 sq ft Downtown Loft apartment in the heart of the City of Salem Oregon. This brand new apartment has high ceilings and aerial city views. Everything turned out lovely, from the quartz countertops to the carpets. You have every amenity and are in the center of the City. 1/2 block from the Willamette River front park, all the cool restaurants and bars/coffee shops. You will want for nothing, it is all at your fingertips. Come stay downtown and enjoy some City Living with all the convenience

The space
Please let me know who is staying in the house when you booked the property. If you've booked this property under someone else's name please let me know the name of the guest that will be staying in the house. It's important for security reasons thank you for your understanding, Angela

I am so excited to share this new listing and brand-new apartment. Built in the heart of the city where everyone wants to stay and play. 2 bedrooms both with queen size
neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood
This loft is located 4 city blocks from Oregon State Capitol. 5 city blocks from Willamette University. 2 blocks from Salem Convention Center. 1 block from Riverfront park and Willamette River. Front door opens to downtown boutique shops and restaurants. Full service mall, Salem Center, with 65 National and local brands stores. There is a Cinema with 7 theaters that offers food and alcohol at your theater seat. We are 10 blocks from Salem Hospital and birthing center. We are 11 blocks from historical Bush Park, gardens and art barn next to Deepwood historical mansion.
Parks
Riverfront Park is a 23-acre park located in downtown Salem along the Willamette River and connects to Wallace Marine Park which has 114.45 acres. It is the home of one of the best sports facilities in the Northwest and has miles of walking, jogging and biking paths and is also a haven for bird watchers.

neighborhood_overview:
You are in the downtown area and though it is very safe (the new police station is being built only 4 blocks away), this is a metro area and there are two homeless support facilities in the downtown area so you will see the people they support. We have never had any issues or any of our guests, but it is a part of life in many cities and you should be aware of it, if this will be a concern for you we recommend you look for a property outside of the downtown area.

This is a mid century modern building that was built in the 1964, it is VERY well maintained and well built with unique stone aggregate siding. It is not a new building but it is well built with large units and an amazing location right on the creek. All units have been updated, but please be aware of the age of the building as some people have commented it was older. It has a lot of character that you do not get in a modern building.

If you like cooking, the full-sized fridge will handle your food storage needs. Need groceries? Fred Meyer is only a 15-minute walk or a quick couple minute drive away. With multiple parks close by there's always something to do! Grab a cup of coffee at Broadway Coffee House on your way into downtown.

name: The Iris Room
description:
1926 artist's cottage, two blocks from historic Bush Park. Queen bed in downstairs room, private bathroom. Shared living room, dining room, kitchen, spacious back yard. Electric vehicle charger, off street parking available by discussion. Short-term rental License #22-102644-LI Please have your own profile when you book, and do not book a reservation for anyone else. security camera on porch, just FYI. No check-in after 9:30p

The space
Beauty, comfort, and creativity are important to me, and what I aim to share with others. Wood floors, tall ceilings, natural light, and simple furnishings provide a relaxing atmosphere. The walls are hung with my paintings and fabric art. I love the outdoors as much as the indoors, and Bush Park is two blocks away. Walk along Pringle Creek under the tall firs, then come back and work in private, or join me in the living room for conversation or a good book.

Guest access
Cozy living room with many comfortable
neighborhood_overview: Small bungalows and quiet streets make for an interesting morning walk, or you can go two blocks north into Bush Park. There you will be in tall firs and oaks, along Pringle Creek, with both gravel walkways and paved sidewalks. The neighborhood is quiet, although Berry St sees its share of cars coming and going into Salem, just a mile away. Sirens are in the distance, since the hospital is a half-mile, but they are not loud. I occasionally hear the train whistle, which I enjoy.
host_about: I moved to Salem, Oregon in 2004 and love being close to our parks, the coast, and the mountains. I teach art at the community college. I love painting, reading, sewing and Nature. I've been a member of AirBnB since 2013, and enjoy meeting new people and visiting new places. I look forward to hosting you!

name: Newly remodeled modern home in South Salem
description:
Enjoy this unattached home near restaurants and grocery stores in South Salem. This is a two bedroom rental and one full bathroom house. Two bedrooms are available to rent. The third bedroom is locked and used as storage. This home is on our property for work and is a shared parking space with customers.
The kitchen is stocked with everything you need to make a meal, bake or close restaurants if you want takeout.

The space
This house is in the parking lot of our work office. It’s a separate house not attached to any other buildings. The only shared space is the parking spaces. We ask that you park one car Monday through Wednesday in the parking lot. Outside of those days you can park in any of the spots.

The home has a keyless entry and you will get a code prior to your stay. The home is three bedrooms but two of the bedrooms are locked for storage.

If you stay for an extended period of time we may need access to the garage or storage

name: Clean | Long Stays | W/D in Unit | Keyless Entry
description:
♡ Save and Share, Keep an Eye on it ♡

Traveling can be exciting, but it's not without challenges. Having a safe, clean and relaxing space to recharge can make all of the difference.

This cozy unit, being centrally located 1 mile east of downtown Salem makes it the perfect landing pad for those traveling and their families for a month or more.

Need to work? Love to cook? Time to relax?
We have you covered! From a dedicated work space, blazing fast wifi, Smart Tv's to a full kitchen.

name: Bright and Modern Townhome - Perfect for Any Stay
description:
Welcome to our newly built townhome! Our fully furnished and equipped home features an open-concept main floor with a fully equipped kitchen and a spacious living room, as well as a private deck with city views. The upstairs has two bedrooms and one private den, each with a queen sized bed, as well as a washer and dryer. Located in a safe and friendly neighborhood, our home is conveniently located near shopping and local attractions. Come and experience all that Salem has to offer!

The space
Welcome to our newly built and luxurious townhome! Our fully furnished rental is the perfect blend of cozy and chic.

Downstairs, you'll find a spacious and modern kitchen that is fully equipped with everything you need to cook and entertain. The open-concept living room features a comfortable couch, a large TV, dining area, and plenty of natural light. There is also a convenient half bathroom on this level. The deck offers city views and spectacular sunsets!
<
neighborhood_overview:
This is a neighborhood with other townhomes and homes around. It is in the city and will have some road/traffic noise.
it is close to shopping and dining and right off a main street!
host_about:
We are an adventurous couple currently living in the Pacific Northwest, who frequent the east coast. We love exploring and trying new things, and we are always up for stepping out of our comfort zone.

Hosting on Airbnb is one of our favorite ways to share our love of adventure with others. We love meeting new people and helping them have the best possible experience in our area. Whether you are here for a short vacation or a longer stay, we hope you'll enjoy all that the Pacific Northwest and the Upstate has to offer!

Enter Wonderland. Travel through the looking glass vortex to this unique artistically designed space full of whimsy. The canopy bed will have you sleeping like the Queen of Hearts, while the locally created mural art in the Cheshire Room gives you a perfect backdrop as a reading nook.
The Eat Me/Drink Me snacks will await your arrival. Will you be able to fit through the tiny mouse doors to find even more adventure?
Enjoy the mirrors on the ceiling while lounging on the fainting couch.

The space
The full kitchen will allow you to create a full Tea Party experience, to dine at the large Mad Hatter’s table.
The small bathroom is covered in the eucalyptus vines of Alice’s garden.

Outside, dine in the rose garden under the solar lights.

There is a washer and dryer in the building, that takes coin, or an app to use.

Inquire about monthly rentals!

name: Soleil
description:
This darling one-bedroom apartment is situated at the top of of a 1900s build, historical home.
It’s breezy and light boho decor is accompanied by an indoor light up swing hammock, a queen sized memory foam bed, and a full kitchen stocked with essentials.
This apartment has gorgeous natural light, or you can lounge at the bistro table on the front porch, or the community garden out back.

Less than one mile to Salem Health Center, Willamette University, and the Capital Building.

The space
There are four private apartments in this historical building, each with its own entry. No interaction with the other tenants.

This is a cozy space- 450 sq feet. Perfect for a single person, or a romantic couple.
This apartment has a queen sized memory foam bed, a hanging LED lit swing hammock, a bathroom with shower (no tub,) a full kitchen with cooking utensils and equipment, and a full set of dishes, and a dining area with seating for two.

name: Bright and Open Home-Jetted Tub in Primary Suite
description:
Welcome to the private main level of my home! The connected living room, dining area, and kitchen create a cohesive space that encourages connection and interaction. The kitchen is fully equipped with everything you need to cook, and there are two dedicated workspaces for remote work. I live on the lower level with a private entrance, but you'll hardly notice me or my dog downstairs.

The space
This house has a bright and open floor plan with the living room, dining room, and kitchen all connected and visible from one side of the space to the other. There are live plants in the house and they thrive in the bright space with south facing windows.

The living room has a couch, chair, coffee table, 65 inch Roku TV, and a desk behind the couch. There is no cable TV in the house but I am signed into my streaming services. There is Netflix, Hulu, HBO, Apple TV, and Disney Plus.

The kitchen has many tools to cook and eat a meal, including pots
neighborhood_overview:
West Salem has two grocery stores, restaurants and nightlife on Edgewater Street, and parks all within a mile of this house. Orchard view park is less than 1/4 mile away and has tennis courts, an open field, a playground, and a short woodsy walk along a creek.

It takes less than 10 minutes to drive into downtown Salem.

Please be aware that Cascade Drive can be a busy street. I have provided a white noise machine in the front bedroom in case the cars become bothersome at night.

The neighborhood right around the house is very safe and my neighbors are very nice.
host_about: Hi, I'm Jillian.  I recently bought my dream house but it is definitely more than I can afford.  Luckily, I love being hospitable and I'm very excited to share the main part of this house with you while I live in the basement apartment.  I've spent the past couple months furnishing, decorating, and cleaning this space to make it something I am proud of and that my guests can feel at home in while experiencing a unique space that is decorated with lots of love.  If there is anything that I can do to improve your stay, I would love to be of assistance.  I will not intrude on your stay but if you have any issues or requests, I am right downstairs and happy to help.

description:
1,100 sq ft Downtown loft apartment in the heart of the City of Salem Oregon. This brand new apartment has high ceilings and aerial city views. Everything turned out lovely, from the quartz countertops to the carpets. You have every amenity and are in the center of the City. 1/2 block from the Willamette Riverfront park, all the cool restaurants, and bars/coffee shops. You will want for nothing, it is all at your fingertips. Come stay downtown and enjoy some City Living with all the convenience.

The space
Please let me know who is staying in the house when you booked the property. If you've booked this property under someone else's name please let me know the name of the guest that will be staying in the house. It's important for security reasons thank you for your understanding, Angela

I am so excited to share this new listing and brand-new apartment. Built-in the heart of the city where everyone wants to stay and play. 2 bedrooms one with a king-size
neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood
This loft is located 4 city blocks from Oregon State Capitol. 5 city blocks from Willamette University. 2 blocks from Salem Convention Center. 1 block from Riverfront park and Willamette River. Front door opens to downtown boutique shops and restaurants. Full service mall, Salem Center, with 65 National and local brands stores. There is a Cinema with 7 theaters that offers food and alcohol at your theater seat. We are 10 blocks from Salem Hospital and birthing center. We are 11 blocks from historical Bush Park, gardens and art barn next to Deepwood historical mansion.
Parks
Riverfront Park is a 23-acre park located in downtown Salem along the Willamette River and connects to Wallace Marine Park which has 114.45 acres. It is the home of one of the best sports facilities in the Northwest and has miles of walking, jogging and biking paths and is also a haven for bird watchers.

name: Suede
description:
Imagine a gentleman sitting at a table, working on his laptop. His laptop has a suede binding to it, and it’s accompanying briefcase is a vintage sepia toned enclosure which looks as though it has recently been hand-brushed. His fedora is perched intentionally on the seat next to him, and his pocket square and sibling pocket watch are a display of elegance.

The space
His shoes are expertly shined, and his style catches your eye because it is both sophisticated and understated. He isn’t creating a show for attention, as he never looks up from his work; he simply is the epitome of elegance and style.

This apartment has been designed with this gentleman in mind. Where would a traveling professional like himself like to stay, without the noise of a hotel room? What would his choice color palate be, and which decor would he want on the walls? The answers we came up with, are what you will find in Suede; a small studio apartment with style.
This apart

One mile to downtown.

name: Bush Park & Downtown Charmer Salem's Best Location
description:
Step inside and be greeted by a warm and welcoming atmosphere. The living area is large and the floor plan is open. Each room has cozy beds, stylish decor and natural light. The office is an added bonus for a quiet workplace.

The home has 4 rooms and an office. The location is unbeatable. The house looks out over Bush Park; where you can enjoy the 90+ acres of paths and meadows. Downtown is a 10 minute walk; close to food, shops, entertainment, Willamette University, and the State Capitol.

The space
One room with a King Bed and a bathroom are on the main level.

Three rooms with Queen Beds, a full bathroom, and an additional dedicated office are located on the second floor.

There is a full partially-finished basement with laundry.

The living and dining rooms are large and open to each other. Plenty of seating for a large group at the table to enjoy dinner while looking out at Bush Park or relax in front of the 65" ROKU
neighborhood_overview:
The area is historic and is known as the Gaiety Hill / Bush Park neighborhood. The majority of homes are well-maintained English Cottage, Colonial, Cape Cod, Norman Farmhouse, and French Renaissance homes. It's fun to see and admire the older homes on your walk into Downtown Salem.

There is a great kid's park right across the street on the Salem Hospitals Campus. The Park is open to the public and is well kept.

Bush Park is another major highlight. Bush Park resulted from a land donation from the Bush family many years ago. The Bush museum and historic rose garden are just across the street from our house. Bush Park in total is over 90 acres. The Park includes paths, running trails, meadows, and White Oak groves. A couple of playgrounds dot the area, there is a soapbox racing hill, and pickup soccer or Ultimate Frisbee games can be found in summertime.

The neighborhood is South of the business/downtown district in Salem and is close to the Deepwood Esta
host_about: I grew up in the Willamette Valley of Oregon and work locally as a Real Estate Broker. My family has been Airbnb traveling in the United States, Mexico, and Europe and we are excited to host others through Airbnb. Please ask me about places to eat, local wineries, popular neighborhoods ... anything!

description:
Stretch out and relax in this spacious upstairs bedroom, with space to lounge, kick back and watch TV, plug in your electronics and work at an expansive desk with high speed WiFi. Enjoy a brief walk to Salem's illustrious Bush Park, or bike or drive to downtown to explore art museums, coffee shops, and top restaurants. host_about:
Outdoorsy, corporate hippy. I love meeting new people and living new experiences, wherever I am.  I work in sustainability and climate change. I think life is too short to not constantly challenge yourself and you're never too old to learn something new and keep growing.

Favorite travel experiences were Kathmandu, Nepal; Costa Rica; and any time I get to see my host family in Germany.  I'm fluent in German and can get by in Spanish.  I love all colors, except black.  Flowers are essential and I grow as many as I can.  I love yoga, hiking, paddleboarding, biking, photography, dancing, and practice meditation on a regular basis.

name: Entire Home by Bush Park, Hospital & Willamette U
description:
Come relax and watch a movie, read a book , or make a meal in the kitchen that's equipped w/ all the basic necessities you need to feel at home.
Rooms come w/ closets and hangers and extra linens.
Easy access to everything from this perfectly located homebase in Salem, Oregon. A short walk or bike ride to downtown, Salem Hospital and Bush Park.
Rest assured, we live a short 10 minute drive or quick text or call away if needed. New central heat/cooling, Wi-Fi, W/D, & dishwasher for you to enjoy.

The space
Two rooms, one queen bed and a full bed are located on the first floor. Each room has a closet and the bathroom is in between. Up the narrow 24" stairs, a 3rd room w/ a twin mattress is located along w/ a walk-in closet if needed. The garage has a new W/D and access to the backyard. The garage is not for parking cars, but you can park bicycles.

Guest access
Full use of home, which includes 3 bedrooms, a bathroom, kitchen, l
neighborhood_overview:
Great walkable/bikeable neighborhood just one short block to Bush Park which offers multiple baseball fields, oak forests and green spaces lined with trails and a great playground for the kids. The playground is very close (easy 5 minute walk with kids) from the home.
The Salem Hospital is located on the opposite side of Bush park, about a 12-15 minute walk from the home and on flat terrain.

Inside Bush Park, there is a nice creek passing through it with a path to wander on & cool down during the summer.

There are several food places and bars within a short distance along with plenty of food delivery service operations (doordash, Ubereats,GrubHub). Conveniently located near the hospital (.5miles or?) and just a short trip to downtown . It's a great neighborhood to wander if you just want to get out and see the area on foot.

name: Downtown Historic Loft Above McMenamins
description:
This historic loft is designed with a mid-century modern design palate, sourced locally throughout the Willamette Valley - from the vintage furniture, to the stone and wood shower and even the many plant varietals which live throughout the space. With over 1700 square feet, this space provides nostalgic comfort with all of the modern amenities you would expect. The second living room is set-up with a large TV, bar area and a large live wood community table for 10. Did we mention there's PAC-MAN?

The space
The property is historic, being one of the first buildings built in the City of Salem. This building even served as the first Treasury for the State of Oregon. While it is historic, the building has been completely updated with all of the modern infrastructure and insulation - but it still has retained it historic charm. The space is located on-top of the McMenamins' Boons Treasury Restaurant & Bar.

There are two living rooms on the property one larg
neighborhood_overview: Sitting just north of downtown Salem's Central  Business District, this historic property is nestled on the edge of the Central Area Neighborhood Development Organization (CAN-DO) where it meets the Grant Neighborhood Association.  Just a few blocks east from the Willamette River, this areas main thoroughfare is Broadway, which connects Downtown through a residential corridor to the Broadway urban infill area centered by Broadway Coffeehouse.
host_about: My name is Lillian, and I live in Salem, Oregon with my husband Josh and Golden Retriever, Scooter. Professionally, I am a residential real estate agent, representing custom home builders and Buyers throughout the Willamette Valley. I have a passion for travel, adventure and experiencing all that life has to offer!

This large studio has a full-size bed, a full-size sofa bed, a workspace, and a fully stocked kitchen including a washer and drier. Enjoy your coffee on the patio and walk to your meetings at the State.

The space
This space is my landing pad during the week, but it can be yours when I’m away on weekends to see my children. The apartment is airy and bright with excellent views.

Guest access
The apartment is yours!

Other things to note
Please note that this is a secure building, but this means I can only check you in between the hours of 5-9 pm except in cases of delayed flights.

I love to stay in neighborhoods when I travel, even though I'm usually limited in my exploration because of all day meetings.  I'm a low maintenance guest!

name: Central Salem Hideaway Studio
description:
Our Hideaway studio is a cozy, recently renovated studio apartment located within walking distance of downtown Salem, the state Capitol, and Willamette University. The Hideaway has total privacy, with your own entrance, full bathroom, kitchenette, and washer & dryer.

Our neighborhood is close enough to downtown to enjoy walking to local restaurants, shops, Riverfront Park, and more. The I-5 freeway is a 5-minute drive from our home, making it easy to get to neighboring cities.

The space
The Hideaway studio is located at the basement level of our home with the main level occupied by our family of 4. You will have your own entrance with complete privacy* (see note below regarding emergency scenarios). The Hideaway has a queen bed with a brand-new cooling-gel memory foam mattress, cadet heater in main room and bathroom, your own washer & dryer in the closet with a dresser, WiFi, and TV with Amazon Firestick and PlayStation. The PlayStation has a few games
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a cozy part of central Salem with many homes built in the early 1900’s close to downtown and the state Capitol. You can enjoy the walk down through the Capitol mall to downtown within 10-15 minutes at a leisurely pace. Along with great shops and restaurants, we are close to Riverfront Park on the Willamette river, Willamette University's beautiful campus, and the Hallie Ford Art Museum. The Salem Saturday Market is a quick 5-8 minute walk that is a great place to visit and browse local vendors during spring to early fall.
host_about:
I’m a Pacific Northwest girl through and through, lover of books and studying brain development research, and a big fan of bilingual learning. I enjoy traveling either locally with my family to help encourage our boys’ sense of wonder and exploration, or with friends to other parts of the states. 

My favorite places I have visited include: Ecuador, Israel, the Philippines, and the California Coast. I would love to travel to other parts of South & Central America (I speak fluent spanish), and the Amalfi Coast in Italy.

Start the morning with coffee in the fully equipped kitchen, then spend the day sightseeing or use the dedicated workspace to knock out some remote work. After, kick back with a movie night in the living room!

name: Far East Escape
description:
This one bedroom apartment, decorated with a nod to the beauty of an Asian aesthetic, is a perfect space for a traveling professional.
There is a queen size memory foam bed, as well as a full-size futon pullout. There is a traditional Japanese floor tea table, as a dining space.

This private apartment comes with a fully stocked kitchen, coin laundry in the basement, ROKU Tv, and great Wi-Fi.

The apartment is located in a prime area, one mile from downtown, the state capital, and Salem Health.

The space
The building has eight apartments. Four of them are ours, for corporate housing. The other four are permanent residents who are mostly quiet and respectful.

Each apartment is completely private with their own kitchens, bathrooms, etc.
The basement has shared coin-operated laundry.

Plenty of dishes and linens for your needs. There is a starter set of coffee and tea, as well as some small meal and snack items in t

Walking distance to some of our favorite breakfast and coffee spots.
One mile to downtown, the capital, and Salem Health.

description:
Relax with the whole family in our peaceful neighborhood. If you enjoy walking, the entire neighborhood is a great area to walk with many elevation changes. You can get a decent view of the nearby Cascade mountain range while out and about. There is an elementary school within walking distance with a playground as well.

The space
The house is two stories with the living area, kitchen, dining and laundry on the first floor. The second floor has three bedrooms and the two bathrooms. The floors are all laminate with area rugs in the living rooms.

Guest access
The house is available except the Garage, Upstairs Closet and Master Bedroom Closet.
Please feel free to use the appliances. Dishwasher soap is underneath the sink. Detergent is in the Downstairs Laundry Closet.

Cleaning supplies are also located underneath the kitchen sink and in the Downstairs Laundry Closet. Use them as needed in case of any spills.
